job_title: Front End Engineer - Alexa Shopping List
job_description: Experience with object-oriented design 2+ years of professional non-internship experience with front end, web or mobile software development using JavaScript, HTML and CSS With Alexa devices proliferating across homes, offices, cars and mobile, Alexa is going to play a significant role in helping customers capture their needs in the moment. The Alexa Shopping List team is enabling this vision by becoming the preferred way to capture and manage customers' grocery needs. By combining the ease of talking to Alexa with social shopping through sophisticated AI to automatically build your list and find you the best deals, we will transform how customers shop in stores and online. We will help customers anticipate and keep track of what they need, help them save time and get the best value while shopping. We will ensure they always get everything on their shopping list without forgetting anything. What you will do: You will have the opportunity to contribute to and develop deep expertise in the areas of distributed systems, machine learning, conversational technologies, front-end app development, data storage and data pipelines. You'll have the freedom (and encouragement) to experiment, improve, invent, and innovate on behalf of our customers. You will have an impact on Amazon's Alexa experiences and the way shopping is done in the area of virtual assistants, chatbots and IoT. And finally you will have the satisfaction of being able to look back and say you were a key contributor to something special from its earliest stages. You will be working closely with multiple product managers and engineers from partner teams in Amazon Retail, Alexa, Speech Recognition and a Research Sciences team. What we are looking for a talented and experienced engineer to design and develop the voice and visual experiences, machine learning models and the distributed systems that bring this vision together. We will welcome previous experience in any one of these areas or a full-stack experience that spans multiple front-end and backend technologies. Proficiency in declarative/reactive UI paradigms or frameworks such as React (Web), React Native, SwiftUI etc. Computer Science fundamentals in object-oriented design, data structure, algorithm design and complexity analysis. Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers. Experience in any one or more of the following areas: distributed systems, app development, full-stack development. Knowledge of professional software engineering practices & best practices for the full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations. Ability to take a project from scoping requirements through actual launch of the project. Experience in communicating with users, other technical teams, and management to collect requirements, describe software product features, and technical designs.
html_job_description:
• Experience with object-oriented design

We will help customers anticipate and keep track of what they need, help them save time and get the best value while shopping. We will ensure they always get everything on their shopping list without forgetting anything.
What you will do: You will have the opportunity to contribute to and develop deep expertise in the areas of distributed systems, machine learning, conversational technologies, front-end app development, data storage and data pipelines. You'll have the freedom (and encouragement) to experiment, improve, invent, and innovate on behalf of our customers. You will have an impact on Amazon's Alexa experiences and the way shopping is done in the area of virtual assistants, chatbots and IoT. And finally you will have the satisfaction of being able to look back and say you were a key contributor to something special from its earliest stages. You will be working closely with multiple product managers and engineers from partner teams in Amazon Retail, Alexa, Speech Recognition and a Research Sciences team.

job_description: ***Local candidates highly preferred *** We are currently looking for a .NET Developer to join our team on a 6 month plus contract basis. This role will be full remote, but we would prefer someone local that can come in for meetings from time to time. In this position you will be focused on back-end development for our data warehouse platform. This will include writing CRUD pages for editing data in our application database, writing API integrations, and hopefully writing new applications to help our team pull data and gain insights on our customer data. TechnicalRequirements: 5+ years of Microsoft Development experience Proficiency with C#, ASP.NET Core, MVC Razor, Entity Framework, and SQL Server Strong experience writing RESTful APIs and understanding of design patterns. Strong experience with SQL databases and stored procedures Experience designing and delivering data solutions Properly unit test and debug code before deployment Proficient creating basic UIs with JavaScript, jQuery, and CSS ***No Sponsorship Available, No 3rd parties***
html_job_description:
***Local candidates highly preferred ***


We are currently looking for a .NET Developer to join our team on a 6 month plus contract basis. This role will be full remote, but we would prefer someone local that can come in for meetings from time to time. In this position you will be focused on back-end development for our data warehouse platform. This will include writing CRUD pages for editing data in our application database, writing API integrations, and hopefully writing new applications to help our team pull data and gain insights on our customer data.


TechnicalRequirements:

  • 5+ years of Microsoft Development experience
  • Proficiency with C#, ASP.NET Core, MVC Razor, Entity Framework, and SQL Server
  • Strong experience writing RESTful APIs and understanding of design patterns.
  • Strong experience with SQL databases and stored procedures
  • Experience designing and delivering data solutions
  • Properly unit test and debug code before deployment
  • Proficient creating basic UIs with JavaScript, jQuery, and CSS


***No Sponsorship Available, No 3rd parties***

job_description: A global leader in the healthcare industry is seeking skilled Azure Cloud Architects local to Orange County to assist in the migration and building out of their cloud environment. Experience in cloud architecture, cloud migrations, and working knowledge of micro-services environments will be beneficial for engineers in this position. If you are looking to advance your career with the support of a large enterprise team, working on projects that will sharpen your cloud computing and architectural skills, apply now! Engineers in this position will get exposure to new technology in the Saas and micro-service spaces, as well as an accelerated growth path. Required Skills & Experience Strong understanding of hybrid cloud strategy, architecture, components, products and technologies Experience with Azure and Azure DevOps (VSTS) Demonstrated hands-on experience with application migration to the cloud Prior experience with cloud management is a plus Prior experience working in a DevOps environment Experience working in an AGILE or SCRUM environment Desired Skills & Experience Exposure and understanding of cloud architecture Experience and familiarity with micro-service environments Experience working in enterprise environments What You Will Be Doing Tech Breakdown 50% Azure Cloud Architecture 50% Cloud Migration Daily Responsibilities 70% Hands On 10% Management Duties 20% Team Collaboration The Offer Competitive Salary: Up to $160K/year, DOE You Will Receive The Following Benefits Medical Insurance & Health Savings Account (HSA) 401(k) Paid Sick Time Leave Pre-tax Commuter Benefit Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future. Jobspring Partners, part of the Motion Recruitment network, provides IT Staffing Solutions (Contract, Contract-to-Hire, and Direct Hire) in major North American markets. Our unique expertise in today’s highest demand tech skill sets, paired with our deep networks and knowledge of our local technology markets, results in an exemplary track record with candidates and clients.

  • Exposure and understanding of cloud architecture
  • Experience and familiarity with micro-service environments
  • Experience working in enterprise environments

What You Will Be Doing

Tech Breakdown
  • 50% Azure Cloud Architecture
  • 50% Cloud Migration

Daily Responsibilities
  • 70% Hands On
  • 10% Management Duties

The Offer
  • Competitive Salary: Up to $160K/year, DOE


You Will Receive The Following Benefits

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future.

job_description: Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 286 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies. Job Description Summary: PayPal has hundreds of millions active users and double-digit growth and is integrated with countless merchants and systems. Come join the routing software infrastructure team that manages all external traffic into PayPal's services. We are looking for a software engineers to help us build products that will ensure services are highly available and highly performant and maintains border security. PayPal’s Routing Team is looking for an engineer with experience in networking and internet protocols, with Golang experience as a plus. The perfect candidate will have great engineering skills as well as a passion for quality and delivering highly available services. You will be joining a team, which delivers at high frequency while maintaining availability, performance, scalability and security. Job Description: Typical Engineer responsibilities: Design, develop and test features, i.e. ownership from start to finish Load and performance testing Support routing components in live, by triaging live issues A Successful Engineer: Deliver solid implemented and tested features using TDD Follows good engineering practices Excellent team member Works well in agile environment Seeks to improve and to help others improve Does not cut corners Requirements: BS w/ 2-3 years experience or MS in Computer Science or a related field. Exceptional candidates with less experience considered 2+ years experience with Go/Java/C++ Golang experience a plus Previous experience in routing layer Understanding of HTTP, TCP, networking Experience with multi-threading/concurrent programming Testing fundamentals, both unit and functional testing Ownership of quality Excellent communication skills Must be a self-learner We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom. PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. REQ ID R0057236

Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.

Job Description Summary:
PayPal has hundreds of millions active users and double-digit growth and is integrated with countless merchants and systems. Come join the routing software infrastructure team that manages all external traffic into PayPal's services. We are looking for a software engineers to help us build products that will ensure services are highly available and highly performant and maintains border security. PayPal’s Routing Team is looking for an engineer with experience in networking and internet protocols, with Golang experience as a plus. The perfect candidate will have great engineering skills as well as a passion for quality and delivering highly available services. Job Description:
Typical Engineer responsibilities:

  • Design, develop and test features, i.e. ownership from start to finish

  • Support routing components in live, by triaging live issues


A Successful Engineer:

  • Deliver solid implemented and tested features using TDD

  • Excellent team member
  • Works well in agile environment
  • Seeks to improve and to help others improve
  • Does not cut corners

  • Understanding of HTTP, TCP, networking
  • Experience with multi-threading/concurrent programming

job_description: Minimum Required Skills SQL, Python, Automation, Scripting, Postgres, MongoDB, Selenium, AWS, API, Automated Testing Job Title QA Automation Engineer Job Location Fairfax County, VA (Remote for now) Job Salary Depends on Experience Requirements QA Automation, Testing, Scripting, Python, SQL What You Will Be Doing Develop test strategies that are a mix of manual and automation testing methods, leveraging automation wherever possible. Collaborate with Product and Ops team to translate functional requirements into test cases. Engage with developers and product owner to understand and analyze software features and requirements in order to develop detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test plans and test cases. Prioritize and plan testing activities. Build automated test infrastructure. Leverage scripts and automation tools to build, integrate and test TMT software products within the automated test infrastructure. Execute manual test cases, automated tests and perform regression testing Work alongside DevOps Engineers to integrate test harnesses into the programs CICD pipelines to automate the building, validation, and deployment of code across environments. Identify and report issues found and verify that issues are resolved. Reproduce issues reported from operations, CSMs and customers. Assist development with any necessary setup and reproduction as well as debugging in any of the non-production and production environments. Validate and verify customer integrations and answer questions from the field. Write SQL queries and import data into Excel to create product reports for Operations, CSMs, and customers. What You Need for this Position 5+ years of experience as a Quality Assurance Engineer performing test estimation, test case preparation, manual test execution, executing automation scripts and regression testing, and defect management. 5+ years of experience in test automation in cloud and data center environments. 5+ years of experience QA testing web-based applications and backend applications (REST services, platforms). Experience with Test rails or other test case management software. Experience with Agile-Scrum and other Agile methodologies and industry-standard practices and tools, such as Jira and Confluence. Experience with client interaction and communication. Understand multiple stages of testing, from unit, functional, integration, system, and performance or stress. Experience reporting and tracking bugs, solving complex problems triaging issues.So, if you are a QA Automation Engineer with experience, please apply today!   • Identify and report issues found and verify that issues are resolved.
  • Reproduce issues reported from operations, CSMs and customers. Assist development with any necessary setup and reproduction as well as debugging in any of the non-production and production environments.

  • Validate and verify customer integrations and answer questions from the field.
  • Write SQL queries and import data into Excel to create product reports for Operations, CSMs, and customers.

  • 5+ years of experience QA testing web-based applications and backend applications (REST services, platforms).

job_description: When hired into the Software Intern Program, you reap big benefits. During your internship, you will gain insights into Cerner’s engineering methodology that will prepare you for a long-term, meaningful career. Cerner Software Engineers create industry-leading technology that impacts patient care and/or Cerner business around the globe. As a Software Intern, you’ll be a part of the team from day one and may work with a variety of languages and platforms. You will work on real project work understanding user needs, providing input to design, developing applications, writing automated tests, and troubleshooting issues across Cerner's technology solutions. Please note, employer-based immigration sponsorship is not available for this position (e.g., CPT, OPT, J-1, H-1B, TN), and Cerner is unable to complete any immigration-related paperwork, including but not limited to, DSO paperwork, Form I-983 training plan, SEVIS documentation, etc. Qualifications Basic Qualifications : Actively pursuing a Technical Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or related field One remaining summer prior to graduation Preferred Qualifications : Proficiency through work experience or academic coursework in developing software using one or more preferred programming languages, including Java, C++, C#, JavaScript, Ruby, Python, etc. Expectations : U.S. work authorization required Relocation to the Kansas City metropolitan area for the duration of the internship (temporary housing available) Ability to work 40 hours per week Active participation in Cerner’s Summer Internship Program
html_job_description:
When hired into the Software Intern Program, you reap big benefits. During your internship, you will gain insights into Cerner’s engineering methodology that will prepare you for a long-term, meaningful career. Cerner Software Engineers create industry-leading technology that impacts patient care and/or Cerner business around the globe.

As a Software Intern, you’ll be a part of the team from day one and may work with a variety of languages and platforms. You will work on real project work understanding user needs, providing input to design, developing applications, writing automated tests, and troubleshooting issues across Cerner's technology solutions.

Please note, employer-based immigration sponsorship is not available for this position (e.g., CPT, OPT, J-1, H-1B, TN), and Cerner is unable to complete any immigration-related paperwork, including but not limited to, DSO paperwork, Form I-983 training plan, SEVIS documentation, etc.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications :

  • Actively pursuing a Technical Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, or related field
  • One remaining summer prior to graduation

Preferred Qualifications :

  • Proficiency through work experience or academic coursework in developing software using one or more preferred programming languages, including Java, C++, C#, JavaScript, Ruby, Python, etc.

Expectations :

  • U.S. work authorization required
  • Relocation to the Kansas City metropolitan area for the duration of the internship (temporary housing available)
  • Ability to work 40 hours per week
  • Active participation in Cerner’s Summer Internship Program

job_description: Front-End Developer (JavaScript) **2 openings **Must have 3+ years of Front End Development Experince. Visa sponsorship not available for this role Your objective will be to build and support robust tools, applications, and frameworks that provide a world class customer experience. As a JavaScript engineer, your work will directly impact our customers experience using our website. Speed and functionality are crucial to our success. To be successful in this role you must be the kind of software engineer who can produce strong front end code; a person who can build great products and provide a great customer experience. We don’t care if you taught yourself, attended a boot camp, or have a Computer Science degree; we care that you know your stuff. This means you have superb software engineering fundamentals, produce thoughtfully designed code that is reliable and maintainable. All of that is meaningless without thorough testing, of course. We’re looking for engineers that are enthusiastic about learning new technologies and skills that will continue to make a difference as we step the next step forward   Essential Job Functions Technologies We Use We expect a strong understanding of JavaScript ES5 and ES6 as well as Webpack and Docker. A large chunk of our application is written in Vue so ideally you’re well antiquated with the framework. As you are developing, testing should be at the forefront of your mind. We use Jasmine to test our JavaScript code. HTML & CSS are the core building blocks for any front-end developer and it’s no different here. We use templating engines such as Dust. For our databases, we heavily rely on Elasticsearch, MySQL, and Redis. We have a couple other platforms in use throughout our applications. Our cloud platform is currently AWS but are transitioning to GCP. It’s important to understand the tools and services offered by a cloud service provider in order to choose the best option for your application. Git push origin source-control. Are there others? Yes. Is our stack fun? Yes. Will you get to work on what interests you? Yes. Should you apply? Yes.   Requirements Degree in Computer Science, a related technical or scientific field, or equivalent experience 3+ years experience as a software engineer.  JavaScript a MUST HAVE Familiarity with continuous integration and build tools Mastery of one programming language and working knowledge of at least one other Familiarity with multiple frameworks from languages and domains Understanding of multiple programming paradigms Good grasp of design patterns and anti-patterns.
html_job_description:
Front-End Developer (JavaScript)

**2 openings

**Must have 3+ years of Front End Development Experince.

Visa sponsorship not available for this role


Your objective will be to build and support robust tools, applications, and frameworks that provide a world class customer experience. As a JavaScript engineer, your work will directly impact our customers experience using our website. Speed and functionality are crucial to our success. To be successful in this role you must be the kind of software engineer who can produce strong front end code; a person who can build great products and provide a great customer experience. We don’t care if you taught yourself, attended a boot camp, or have a Computer Science degree; we care that you know your stuff. This means you have superb software engineering fundamentals, produce thoughtfully designed code that is reliable and maintainable. All of that is meaningless without thorough testing, of course. We’re looking for engineers that are enthusiastic about learning new technologies and skills that will continue to make a difference as we step the next step forward

 

Essential Job Functions

Technologies We Use

  • We expect a strong understanding of JavaScript ES5 and ES6 as well as Webpack and Docker. A large chunk of our application is written in Vue so ideally you’re well antiquated with the framework.
  • As you are developing, testing should be at the forefront of your mind. We use Jasmine to test our JavaScript code.
  • HTML & CSS are the core building blocks for any front-end developer and it’s no different here. We use templating engines such as Dust.
  • For our databases, we heavily rely on Elasticsearch, MySQL, and Redis. We have a couple other platforms in use throughout our applications.
  • Our cloud platform is currently AWS but are transitioning to GCP. It’s important to understand the tools and services offered by a cloud service provider in order to choose the best option for your application.
  • Git push origin source-control.
  • Are there others? Yes. Is our stack fun? Yes. Will you get to work on what interests you? Yes. Should you apply? Yes.

 

Requirements

  • Degree in Computer Science, a related technical or scientific field, or equivalent experience
  • 3+ years experience as a software engineer.  JavaScript a MUST HAVE
  • Familiarity with continuous integration and build tools
  • Mastery of one programming language and working knowledge of at least one other
  • Familiarity with multiple frameworks from languages and domains
  • Understanding of multiple programming paradigms
  • Good grasp of design patterns and anti-patterns.

job_description: LGA is looking for a highly motivated WordPress developer with a passion for creativity, curiosity and a heart for problem solving. We are seeking a WP Developer responsible for both back-end and front-end development, including custom built WordPress sites and plugins. This position requires a combination of programming skills (namely PHP, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript) and aesthetics. The candidate should have a strong understanding of industry trends and content management systems. Experience with the responsive and adaptive design is required. Also, an understanding of the entire web development process, including design, development, and deployment is preferred. This position will report to the Executive Creative Director. WHAT YOU’LL DO Design and build custom WP sites/landing pages for new projects Designing and implementing new features and functionality of legacy sites Establishing and guiding the website’s architecture Ensuring high-performance and availability, and managing all technical aspects of the CMS Helping formulate an effective, responsive design Ability to build clean, turn-key, user-friendly CMS interfaces and provide user guides/training for clients Knowledge of best practices for website accessibility Experience implementing chatbot, database and e-commerce functionality WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR Five + years of work experience with related or transferable skills Good understanding of front-end technologies, including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery Experience building user interfaces for websites and/or web applications Experience using Advanced Custom Fields to tailor custom content Experience designing and developing responsive design websites Ability to understand CSS changes and their ramifications to ensure consistent style across platforms and browsers Ability to convert comprehensive layouts (Adobe XD) and wireframes into working HTML pages Knowledge of how to interact with RESTful APIs and formats (JSON, XML) Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git Strong understanding of PHP back-end development Work closely with and advise creative and strategy teams on best practices and trends for functionality and usability on both desktop and mobile Approach all development with a mobile-first mindset AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER Luquire George Andrews (LGA) participates in E-Verify. LGA is looking for a highly motivated WordPress developer with a passion for creativity, curiosity and a heart for problem solving.


We are seeking a WP Developer responsible for both back-end and front-end development, including custom built WordPress sites and plugins. This position requires a combination of programming skills (namely PHP, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript) and aesthetics. The candidate should have a strong understanding of industry trends and content management systems. Experience with the responsive and adaptive design is required. Also, an understanding of the entire web development process, including design, development, and deployment is preferred.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

job_description: ABOUT US Albert is an instructional platform that empowers teachers to unlock the potential in all learners. We are a team of engineers and educators, advocates and experts creating the practice and assessment platform of the future. Our stack: ● Our core end-user application is written in Javascript built with React ● Our backend services are built with Elixir, Phoenix, and PostgreSQL ● Our core API is RESTful following the JSON API specification ● We have secondary services where we are adopting the use of GraphQL ● Our infrastructure utilizes Google Cloud Platform using Kubernetes, Docker, among other technologies THE ROLE We are currently a team of three front-end engineers, but we collaborate daily with our colleagues on the Back-End, Product, and Design teams. We are passionate about our jobs, and we look forward to coming to work every day. We pride ourselves on our ability to learn from each other and solve problems together. As a member of the front-end team, your daily responsibilities will include: ● Building responsive and performant UIs using React.js ● Supporting our QA team with unit, integration, and end-to-end tests using Jest and React Testing Library ● Writing standards-compliant and accessible HTML (JSX) and CSS from scratch ● Identifying both best practices and anti-patterns in Design and Code Reviews ● Communicating abstract concepts, both verbally and in writing, to technical and non-technical colleagues If this interests you, here is what you can expect in return for working at Albert, and what makes Albert special: ● You will make an immediate impact. Our small size means every engineer is a major contributor to supporting Albert's roadmap. ● You will serve a rewarding user base. Around the world, students in middle school, high school, and beyond use Albert to learn. As a front-end engineer, you will write accessible software that puts them first. ● You will grow as a programmer and as a teammate. We will proudly support you as you solve challenging problems and improve Albert's architecture. LOCATION Albert has a headquarters in Chicago, with some employees distributed across the nation in fully-remote roles. If you prefer to be physically present with co-workers, you would want to be located in Chicago. However, we have had success with remote roles and are willing to hire great colleagues anywhere in the U.S. for remote positions. BENEFITS ● Health, dental, and vision insurance. We offer a range of options, including the BCBS PPO Platinum plan. The company contributes 99% of our great base health plan (employees pay the difference for more expensive plans) and 85% for vision and dental. ● One Medical. We cover the cost of enrollment in One Medical to provide employees with any of our health plans with convenient access to primary care. ● Paid parental leave. Parents are eligible for up to twelve (12) weeks of fully paid parental leave after a year of service. ● A 401k plan. Save for retirement with a fully managed plan. ● Commuter benefit. Use pre-tax earnings on your commute through our managed platform. ● Flexible, guilt-free vacation. Take guilt-free vacations with no hard limit. Just be reasonable and considerate of the company and your teammates. ● Remote work. Prior to COVID, we had a flexible work-from-home policy. As a result of COVID, we are embracing hiring positions remotely, or based from our office in Chicago. When things return to “normal”, we will continue to have a flexible work-from-home approach. QUALIFICATIONS Please note: unfortunately, Albert is unable to offer visa sponsorship at this time. Albert seeks a creative, enthusiastic, and self-motivated front-end engineer to join our front-end team. The ideal candidate is exceptional at front-end development with a concrete skillset in HTML, CSS, and especially JavaScript/ES6+, with at least one year of experience working on a production app or website using React.js. MINIMUM ● 1+ years of experience in a front-end role ● 1+ years of experience with React ● Strong proficiency in CSS and HTML ● Experience with modern JavaScript/ES6+ ● Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field, or relevant professional experience working in a product-driven environment Additionally, strong candidates can demonstrate they are thoughtful, disciplined writers by including a cover letter. PREFERRED ● Experience using Git for version control ● Experience with accessibility guidelines (e.g. WCAG 2.0) ● Experience maintaining a component library or design system ● Experience with TDD and/or testing libraries (e.g. Jest, Testing Library, Mocha, etc.) ● Experience with Javascript build tools (e.g. Webpack, Babel)
html_job_description:
ABOUT US

Albert is an instructional platform that empowers teachers to unlock the potential in all learners. We are a team of engineers and educators, advocates and experts creating the practice and assessment platform of the future.


Our stack:

● Our core end-user application is written in Javascript built with React

● Our backend services are built with Elixir, Phoenix, and PostgreSQL

● Our core API is RESTful following the JSON API specification

● We have secondary services where we are adopting the use of GraphQL

● Our infrastructure utilizes Google Cloud Platform using Kubernetes, Docker, among other technologies


THE ROLE

We are currently a team of three front-end engineers, but we collaborate daily with our colleagues on the Back-End, Product, and Design teams. We are passionate about our jobs, and we look forward to coming to work every day. We pride ourselves on our ability to learn from each other and solve problems together.


As a member of the front-end team, your daily responsibilities will include:


● Building responsive and performant UIs using React.js

● Supporting our QA team with unit, integration, and end-to-end tests using Jest and React Testing Library

● Writing standards-compliant and accessible HTML (JSX) and CSS from scratch

● Identifying both best practices and anti-patterns in Design and Code Reviews

● Communicating abstract concepts, both verbally and in writing, to technical and non-technical colleagues


If this interests you, here is what you can expect in return for working at Albert, and what makes Albert special:


● You will make an immediate impact. Our small size means every engineer is a major contributor to supporting Albert's roadmap.

● You will serve a rewarding user base. Around the world, students in middle school, high school, and beyond use Albert to learn. As a front-end engineer, you will write accessible software that puts them first.

● You will grow as a programmer and as a teammate. We will proudly support you as you solve challenging problems and improve Albert's architecture.


LOCATION

Albert has a headquarters in Chicago, with some employees distributed across the nation in fully-remote roles. If you prefer to be physically present with co-workers, you would want to be located in Chicago. However, we have had success with remote roles and are willing to hire great colleagues anywhere in the U.S. for remote positions.

BENEFITS

● Health, dental, and vision insurance. We offer a range of options, including the BCBS PPO Platinum plan. The company contributes 99% of our great base health plan (employees pay the difference for more expensive plans) and 85% for vision and dental.
● One Medical. We cover the cost of enrollment in One Medical to provide employees with any of our health plans with convenient access to primary care.
● Paid parental leave. Parents are eligible for up to twelve (12) weeks of fully paid parental leave after a year of service.
● A 401k plan. Save for retirement with a fully managed plan.
● Commuter benefit. Use pre-tax earnings on your commute through our managed platform.
● Flexible, guilt-free vacation. Take guilt-free vacations with no hard limit. Just be reasonable and considerate of the company and your teammates.
● Remote work. Prior to COVID, we had a flexible work-from-home policy. As a result of COVID, we are embracing hiring positions remotely, or based from our office in Chicago. When things return to “normal”, we will continue to have a flexible work-from-home approach.


QUALIFICATIONS

Please note: unfortunately, Albert is unable to offer visa sponsorship at this time.


Albert seeks a creative, enthusiastic, and self-motivated front-end engineer to join our front-end team. The ideal candidate is exceptional at front-end development with a concrete skillset in HTML, CSS, and especially JavaScript/ES6+, with at least one year of experience working on a production app or website using React.js.


MINIMUM


● 1+ years of experience in a front-end role

● 1+ years of experience with React

● Strong proficiency in CSS and HTML

● Experience with modern JavaScript/ES6+

● Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field, or relevant professional experience working in a product-driven environment


Additionally, strong candidates can demonstrate they are thoughtful, disciplined writers by including a cover letter.


PREFERRED


● Experience using Git for version control

● Experience with accessibility guidelines (e.g. WCAG 2.0)

● Experience maintaining a component library or design system

● Experience with TDD and/or testing libraries (e.g. Jest, Testing Library, Mocha, etc.)

● Experience with Javascript build tools (e.g. Webpack, Babel)

job_description: The Position The Computational Chemistry and Cheminformatics group seeks a talented and experienced, self-driven software engineer to design, test and deliver software applications and workflows that assist in discovering ground breaking therapeutics. This position will focus on collaborating with scientists, systems analysts, project managers, and software engineers to develop software and systems to enable cutting-edge research in small molecule drug discovery. You will join an interdisciplinary team of scientists and software engineers at our South San Francisco, CA research headquarters. The successful candidate will work directly with cross-functional teams across the small molecule research organization to deliver high-quality, sustainable software and informatics solutions addressing urgent scientific challenges. Projects will span diverse technologies, architectures and problem domains, including cheminformatics, machine learning, artificial intelligence, high performance computing, workflow orchestration, web services and cloud computing. Work will include understanding, maintaining, and extending existing critical applications as well as developing novel tools. The common thread is creating innovative software solutions supporting small molecule R&D groups. Who you are In hiring new employees, we look for people who are also inspired by our mission and who would fit in well with the collaborative, rigorous and entrepreneurial spirit of the company culture. Because we know that employees are critical to our success in bringing novel medicines to patients, we are dedicated to remaining a great place to work and to providing employees with programs, services and benefits that allow them to bring the best to the business and to their personal lives. The ideal candidate will satisfy many of the following requirements: You have demonstrated proficiency in at least one modern programming language such as Python, Java, or Javascript/Typescript You have demonstrated ability to develop and deliver software for a scientific user base You have demonstrated proficiency with version control systems and automated software testing and delivery Demonstrated success working with geographically distributed teams strongly preferred You have a masters degree or equivalent in computer science or a related field You have designed and maintained data models in relational databases Experience with developing web-based applications and/or web services-based architectures strongly preferred You have at least 6+ years of experience within the full software development lifecycle from planning through deployment and maintenance Demonstrated leadership commensurate with level of experience Able to present your work, both verbally and in writing, to diverse audiences including scientists, technical colleagues, and management Experience with node.js, React, or similar technologies is preferred Experience with cheminformatics algorithms and software is preferred Experience in a drug discovery research organization strongly preferred #LI-GL1 #softwareengineer #gREDinformatics Who We Are Genentech, a member of the Roche group and founder of the biotechnology industry, is dedicated to pursuing groundbreaking science to discover and develop medicines for people with serious and life-threatening diseases. To solve the world's most complex health challenges, we ask bigger questions that challenge our industry and the boundaries of science to transform society. Our transformational discoveries include the first targeted antibody for cancer and the first medicine for primary progressive multiple sclerosis. Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) are critical to the success of our company and our impact on society. We believe that by championing diversity of background, thought and experience, we can foster a sense of belonging and provide an environment where every employee feels valued, included, and able to contribute their best for the patients we serve. We’re focused on attracting, retaining, developing and advancing our people to their full potential by rewarding bold ways of thinking and integrating inclusive behaviors into every aspect of our work. The next step is yours. To apply today, click on the "Apply for this job" button. Genentech is an equal opportunity employer & prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, disability, marital & veteran status. For more information about equal employment opportunity, visit our Genentech Careers page . Job Facts JOB FUNCTION Research Informatics COMPANY/DIVISION Pharmaceuticals SCHEDULE Full time JOB TYPE Regular
html_job_description:
The Position

The Computational Chemistry and Cheminformatics group seeks a talented and experienced, self-driven software engineer to design, test and deliver software applications and workflows that assist in discovering ground breaking therapeutics. This position will focus on collaborating with scientists, systems analysts, project managers, and software engineers to develop software and systems to enable cutting-edge research in small molecule drug discovery. You will join an interdisciplinary team of scientists and software engineers at our South San Francisco, CA research headquarters.
The successful candidate will work directly with cross-functional teams across the small molecule research organization to deliver high-quality, sustainable software and informatics solutions addressing urgent scientific challenges. Projects will span diverse technologies, architectures and problem domains, including cheminformatics, machine learning, artificial intelligence, high performance computing, workflow orchestration, web services and cloud computing. Work will include understanding, maintaining, and extending existing critical applications as well as developing novel tools. The common thread is creating innovative software solutions supporting small molecule R&D groups.
Who you are
In hiring new employees, we look for people who are also inspired by our mission and who would fit in well with the collaborative, rigorous and entrepreneurial spirit of the company culture. Because we know that employees are critical to our success in bringing novel medicines to patients, we are dedicated to remaining a great place to work and to providing employees with programs, services and benefits that allow them to bring the best to the business and to their personal lives.

The ideal candidate will satisfy many of the following requirements:

You have demonstrated proficiency in at least one modern programming language such as Python, Java, or Javascript/Typescript

You have demonstrated ability to develop and deliver software for a scientific user base

You have demonstrated proficiency with version control systems and automated software testing and delivery

Demonstrated success working with geographically distributed teams strongly preferred

You have a masters degree or equivalent in computer science or a related field

You have designed and maintained data models in relational databases

Experience with developing web-based applications and/or web services-based architectures strongly preferred

You have at least 6+ years of experience within the full software development lifecycle from planning through deployment and maintenance

Demonstrated leadership commensurate with level of experience

Able to present your work, both verbally and in writing, to diverse audiences including scientists, technical colleagues, and management

Experience with node.js, React, or similar technologies is preferred

Experience with cheminformatics algorithms and software is preferred

Experience in a drug discovery research organization strongly preferred

job_description: Position Summary: The Network Engineer will focus on architecting, implementing, enhancing, and maintaining the company’s computer networks. The infrastructure consists of a variety of wired and wireless networks, including Corporate Office, Remote Offices, Warehouse, Retail Stores, etc. The candidate must have a solid understanding of computer network standards, protocols, security. They will administer, maintain, develop and implement policies and procedures to ensure the security and integrity of the company computer network infrastructure. They will develop and implement data models and designs and resolve any performance issues. They will ultimately be responsible for the overall execution of all functions associated with the administration of computer networks. Responsibilities: 1. Establishing the networking environment by designing system configuration, directing system installation, defining, documenting and enforcing system standards; 2. The design and implementation of new solutions and improving resilience of the current environment; 3. Maximizing network performance by monitoring performance, troubleshooting network problems and outages, scheduling upgrades and collaborating with network architects on network optimization; 4. Undertaking data network fault investigations in local and wide area environments, using information from multiple sources; 5. Securing network systems by establishing and enforcing policies, and defining and monitoring access; 6. Perform support and administration of firewall environments in line with IT security policy; 7. Working with Security Engineer and vendors on Network Security issues; Perform configurations of Firewalls; Perform configuration of Software Defined Perimeter Solutions, Perform configurations of SD-WAN VPN Clouds. 8. Reporting network operational status by gathering and prioritizing information and managing projects; 9. Upgrading data network equipment to the latest stable firmware releases; 10. Perform configuration of routing and switching equipment; 11. Perform configuration of hosted IP voice services; 12. Remote support of on-site engineers and end users/customers during installation; 13. Capacity management, planning, and audit of IP addressing and hosted devices; 14. Disaster Recovery Planning, Testing, and Execution 15. Updating job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks and participating in professional organizations; 16. Working with project management teams, third-line engineers and service desk engineers on a regular basis; 17. Be available for 24x7 Support 18. Manage 3rd Party Service Providers to include: Teleco, ISPs, Managed Service Providers Working Relationships: Under supervision of Manager this position will be responsible for the maintenance of Company’s Network infrastructure. It will require the development and implementation of Network standards throughout the Company’s IT department. This position will have contact will all levels throughout the Company as well as outside vendors and auditors to manage and coordinate the safeguarding of our computer networks. In addition, the position will work closely with System Administrators and IT Security to ensure proper network functioning. JOB REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS Minimum Education: BS Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or related technical field Preferred Education: Master’s Degree in Computer Sciences / related field or equivalent experience Minimum/Preferred Experience: Experience with networking equipment such as Aruba switches, Extreme Networks, Fortinet, Cryptzone, Mako equipment. Extensive working knowledge of IP routing protocols including OSPF, ISIS, MPLS/LDP, and BGP Preferred experience with Cloud technology and Virtual Networks Experience in network and systems security, not only a key understanding of overall concepts, but also the ability to implement policies, processes and develop solutions to network and security problems. Experience working with PCI compliance highly desirable. Hands on experience with Software-Defined Perimeter (SDP) solutions such as Cryptzone AppGate Experience with Fortinet Firewalls and Switches highly desirable Ability to document processes, procedures and network designs clearly and accurately -- not only within our group to share the knowledge and understanding of our own systems, but also for distribution to other internal teams and to our customers. Understanding of Public Key Infrastructure and encryption. Exposure to and experience in software defined Networking technology including Cisco ACI and VMware NSX is a plus Solid understanding of IT Systems and Security fundamentals. Experience in managing projects with specific enterprise networking focus. Experience in organizing and prioritizing one’s own workload and working in an environment where substantial latitude over one’s work schedule is granted. Experience in effective oral and written communications methods. Preferred Licenses/Certifications and Skills: CCNA, CCNP, CCIE, CISSP (dependent on level) ECNA, ECS, ECE, ECA (dependent on level) Fortinet NSE preferred ITIL Foundation certification is preferred Software defined network experience is a plus Microsoft Certified System Administrator is a plus VMware certification is preferred Windows Systems experience Knowledge of Operating system architecture, functions, facilities, and structure Ability to organize and express technical facts well, both orally and in writing. Ability to Consistently maintain the high professional standards in interactions with internal and external counterparts Other: Driving/Fleet Vehicle Requirement: None Travel: Less than 5% Physical: Lift up to 30 lbs Hours & Conditions: This is exempt full time position. Regular 40 hours week is expected. Off hours support might be required.
html_job_description:
Position Summary: The Network Engineer will focus on architecting, implementing, enhancing, and maintaining the company’s computer networks. The infrastructure consists of a variety of wired and wireless networks, including Corporate Office, Remote Offices, Warehouse, Retail Stores, etc. The candidate must have a solid understanding of computer network standards, protocols, security. They will administer, maintain, develop and implement policies and procedures to ensure the security and integrity of the company computer network infrastructure. They will develop and implement data models and designs and resolve any performance issues. They will ultimately be responsible for the overall execution of all functions associated with the administration of computer networks.

Responsibilities:
1. Establishing the networking environment by designing system configuration, directing system installation,
defining, documenting and enforcing system standards;
2. The design and implementation of new solutions and improving resilience of the current environment;
3. Maximizing network performance by monitoring performance, troubleshooting network problems and
outages, scheduling upgrades and collaborating with network architects on network optimization;
4. Undertaking data network fault investigations in local and wide area environments, using information from
multiple sources;
5. Securing network systems by establishing and enforcing policies, and defining and monitoring access;
6. Perform support and administration of firewall environments in line with IT security policy;
7. Working with Security Engineer and vendors on Network Security issues; Perform configurations of Firewalls;
Perform configuration of Software Defined Perimeter Solutions, Perform configurations of SD-WAN VPN
Clouds.
8. Reporting network operational status by gathering and prioritizing information and managing projects;
9. Upgrading data network equipment to the latest stable firmware releases;
10. Perform configuration of routing and switching equipment;
11. Perform configuration of hosted IP voice services;
12. Remote support of on-site engineers and end users/customers during installation;
13. Capacity management, planning, and audit of IP addressing and hosted devices;
14. Disaster Recovery Planning, Testing, and Execution
15. Updating job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications,
maintaining personal networks and participating in professional organizations;
16. Working with project management teams, third-line engineers and service desk engineers on a regular basis;
17. Be available for 24x7 Support
18. Manage 3rd Party Service Providers to include: Teleco, ISPs, Managed Service Providers

Working Relationships: Under supervision of Manager this position will be responsible for the maintenance of Company’s Network infrastructure. It will require the development and implementation of Network standards throughout the Company’s IT department.

This position will have contact will all levels throughout the Company as well as outside vendors and auditors to manage and coordinate the safeguarding of our computer networks. In addition, the position will work closely with System Administrators and IT Security to ensure proper network functioning.

JOB REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS
Minimum Education: BS Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or related technical field
Preferred Education: Master’s Degree in Computer Sciences / related field or equivalent experience

Minimum/Preferred Experience:
  • Experience with networking equipment such as Aruba switches, Extreme Networks, Fortinet, Cryptzone, Mako equipment.
  • Extensive working knowledge of IP routing protocols including OSPF, ISIS, MPLS/LDP, and BGP
  • Preferred experience with Cloud technology and Virtual Networks
  • Experience in network and systems security, not only a key understanding of overall concepts, but also the ability to implement policies, processes and develop solutions to network and security problems. Experience working with PCI compliance highly desirable.
  • Hands on experience with Software-Defined Perimeter (SDP) solutions such as Cryptzone AppGate
  • Experience with Fortinet Firewalls and Switches highly desirable
  • Ability to document processes, procedures and network designs clearly and accurately -- not only within our group to share the knowledge and understanding of our own systems, but also for distribution to other internal teams and to our customers.
  • Understanding of Public Key Infrastructure and encryption.
  • Exposure to and experience in software defined Networking technology including Cisco ACI and VMware NSX is a plus
  • Solid understanding of IT Systems and Security fundamentals. Experience in managing projects with specific enterprise networking focus.
  • Experience in organizing and prioritizing one’s own workload and working in an environment where substantial latitude over one’s work schedule is granted. Experience in effective oral and written communications methods.
Preferred Licenses/Certifications and Skills:
  • CCNA, CCNP, CCIE, CISSP (dependent on level)
  • ECNA, ECS, ECE, ECA (dependent on level)
  • Fortinet NSE preferred
  • ITIL Foundation certification is preferred
  • Software defined network experience is a plus
  • Microsoft Certified System Administrator is a plus
  • VMware certification is preferred
  • Windows Systems experience
  • Knowledge of Operating system architecture, functions, facilities, and structure
  • Ability to organize and express technical facts well, both orally and in writing.
  • Ability to Consistently maintain the high professional standards in interactions with internal and external counterparts
Other:
Driving/Fleet Vehicle Requirement: None
Travel: Less than 5%
Physical: Lift up to 30 lbs
Hours & Conditions: This is exempt full time position. Regular 40 hours week is expected. Off hours support might be required.

job_description: Be a part of a dynamic and diverse team that engineers large-scale, complex and resilient technology solutions that drive our global business. At this role you will help JPMorgan build and optimize digital applications and systems that support millions of customers, clients and employees worldwide. As a member of our Software Engineering Group, we look first and foremost for people who are passionate around solving business problems through innovation and engineering practices. You'll be required to apply your depth of knowledge and expertise to all aspects of the software development lifecycle, as well as partner continuously with your many stakeholders on a daily basis to stay focused on common goals. We embrace a culture of experimentation and constantly strive for improvement and learning. You'll work in a collaborative, trusting, thought-provoking environment-one that encourages diversity of thought and creative solutions that are in the best interests of our customers globally. You will work on engineering modernization of Investment Banking CRM applications, and will partner with Banking and Technology teams to develop and deliver key initiatives throughout the deal lifecycle. In addition, close partnership with product owners will enable the formulation of multi-year strategies ranging from inter-bank initiatives, business and technology disruptors and internal development where efficiency; data insight and market advantage are the priority. Technology alignment with industry practices around Microservices, CI/CD pipeline, DevOps is critical to achieving accelerated development and deliver. This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including: BS/BA degree or equivalent experience Advanced knowledge of application, data, and infrastructure architecture disciplines Understanding of architecture and design across all systems Working proficiency in developmental toolsets Knowledge of industry-wide technology trends and best practices Ability to work in large, collaborative teams to achieve organizational goals Passionate about building an innovative culture Proficiency in C# and building .NET applications for Desktop, Browser and APIs. Understanding of software skills such as business analysis, development, maintenance, and software improvement Strong foundation in Object Oriented Programming and Design Principles (OOP / OOD/ SOLID) Experience in Designing and building data-driven applications applying clean code and architecture principles. Desirable Skills Experience in building WPF applications and Office Add-ins Working knowledge on Java, Spring Boot and Pivotal Cloud Foundry. Understanding of secure coding practices Strong understanding of DevOps and software products lifecycle Proficiency in one more relational databases (SQL Server, Oracle, etc.) Exposure to MongoDB Ability to work in an Agile Team and follow the practices Willing and able to learn the business and understand how and why tasks satisfy business needs Self-starter, ability to work in a fast-paced team environment Strong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills The hiring manager for this job opening would welcome a conversation about flexible working. This could range from ad hoc flexibility in a full time position, to a more formal Flexible Work Arrangement. Our Corporate & Investment Bank relies on innovators like you to build and maintain the technology that helps us safely service the world's important corporations, governments and institutions. You'll develop solutions for a bank entrusted with holding $18 trillion of assets and $393 billion in deposits. CIB provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk, and extends liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world. When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech companies. In 20 technology centers worldwide, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $10B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will are transforming the financial services industry. At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.

job_description: The Delphi Application Developer’s role is to lead the design, development, and implementation of organizational information systems, in particular Warehousing and POS applications. This individual will apply proven communication skills, problem-solving skills, and knowledge of best practices to support our mission-critical information systems. The following are the essential Duties & Responsibilities - Deliver on development projects that meet business requirements and goals, fulfill end-user requirements, and resolve systems issues. Review and analyze existing application effectiveness and efficiency, and then develop strategies for improving or leveraging these systems. One of the primary responsibilities will also be to monitor the usage of critical applications for irregularities and performance issues. He / She will assess usage data and error logs, along with user reports, to determine areas for improvement. Development of new features in existing Delphi application as well as maintenance, support and optimization of existing code. Recommend Best Practices and Procedures to continuously improve software development and support of existing production systems. Collaborate with Business Users / Analysts to determine and document system requirements. Assist in the researching and making of recommendations for new software products and services in support of procurement and development efforts. Ensure that any new software integration into company systems meets functional requirements, system compliance, and interface specifications. Translating business requirements into effective and efficient programming solutions. He / She will assist the IT operations manager to direct the activities of IT technicians, both to directly support End Users and to assist with IT department upgrades and directives. The following are the essential Requirements and Experience need for this position - Proven experience as IT Delphi Developer as well as experience in using Microsoft technologies such as .Net, Azure and SQL Server Minimum of 5 years in a similar role Development experience in a Retail (involving Point of Sale and Warehousing) environment required Delphi Experience required Familiarity with Delphi version (10.x) Delphi UI, database and file IO experience required Firebird Database experience preferred Building web API’s and API clients with Delphi Microsoft technology experience required. .Net, Azure, SQL Server, Visual Studio, etc. Bachelor’s Degree in Information Systems Management and/or an equivalent combination and education and experience Experience with application installation, configuration and analysis required Demonstrated ability to function independently, set direction, and implement solutions that resolve business issues Demonstrated ability to effectively coordinate multiple priorities / projects in a dynamic environment Ability to work independently and in a team environment Strong analytical and negotiating skills required Excellent written and verbal communication skills Excellent organization and interpersonal, conflict resolution and critical problem-solving skills required Job Type: Full-time Pay: $51.00 - $62.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Employee assistance program Employee discount Health insurance Life insurance Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday

html_job_description:
Job Description

Essential Job Functions
  • Codes, tests, debugs, implements, and documents programs. Assists in the modification of company products and/or customer/internal systems to meet the needs of the client and/or end-user.
  • Gathers information from the system, analyzes program and time requirements, and prepares documentation to change existing programs.
  • Researches and analyzes existing systems and program requirements, under periodic supervision.
  • Designs programs for projects or enhancements to existing programs.
  • Writes specifications for programs of low to moderate complexity.
  • Assists in resolving production support problems. Develops and suggests alternative approaches to resolving problems.
  • Develops test plans to verify logic of new or modified programs. Identifies issues as appropriate.
  • Creates appropriate documentation in work assignments such as program code, and technical documentation.
  • Conducts quality assurance activities such as peer reviews.
  • Remains abreast of and researches industry technical trends and new development to maintain current skills and remain current with industry standards.

Basic Qualifications
  • Batch (C, C++. SQL, Unix) – 2+ years
  • SDLC – Software Development Lifecycle
  • Strong SQL with both PL-SQL experience – 4+ years
  • UNIX Operating System – 4+ years
  • Databases - Oracle – 4+ years
  • Data warehousing concepts – 4+ years
  • “C” programming concepts – 4+ years
  • Healthcare provider experience preferred
  • Medicaid/MMIS experience preferred
  • Degree or certification preferred

Knowledge on TMSIS and DSS modules is a plus.

NOTE: This position is available for remote home-based work within the United States.

job_description: Discovery hires the very best and brightest talent who are enthusiastic and passionate to fulfill the company’s mission of empowering people to explore their world and satisfy their curiosity. In exchange for their talent and drive, employees are provided with an engaging, diverse workplace and the resources they need to learn, thrive and grow in their careers. Job Summary The Network Engineer will be responsible for working with the operations and engineering teams around the strategic, tactical, and improvement of the global network platforms. The individual will be evaluating processes regularly to ensure expected outcomes are achieved in the most efficient way along with identifying service improvements and document those improvements. Help ensure standards and processes are followed. Key Responsibilities Effectively support all DCI network infrastructure 24*7 by responding to and resolving all trouble tickets within the stipulated SLA time – 40% Clearly understand the root cause of all the network outages and take remediation steps to prevent the recurrence of the problem – 10% Ability to prioritize work based on business criticalities and also be flexible to work on ad hoc tasks as assigned by the manager – 20% Fully understand and adhere to the team’s network standards and procedures both in technical and functional areas – 20% Maintain positive relationships with all user communities, peers and the management team – 10% Perform other duties as needed. Requirements Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems or similar Minimum of 5 years of experience in system administration in an enterprise production environment Strong skills with OSPF and BGP routing protocols Strong skills with DNS, DHCP, and IPAM platforms Strong skills with Juniper and Cisco routing and switching platforms Strong skills with Cisco and/or Aruba wireless platforms Strong skills with F5 and Netscaler load balancer platforms Understanding of Juniper SRX, Cisco, and Palo Alto firewall platforms Understanding of remote access and VPN technologies Understanding of MPLS networks Understanding of Aruba Clearpass or similar AAA platforms Understanding of network security protocols, standards and policies Understanding and experience with IP Telephony Understanding of wireless networking protocols and standards Understanding of WAN Optimization Technologies Process oriented engineer with strong execution and follow-through skills Able to perform multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize self Strong and consistent customer service and communication skills Willingness to work a flexible schedule and participate in on-call duties Strong team member with self-motivation and desires to improve the infrastructure Excellent troubleshooting, analytical and problem-solving skills Experience with management, monitoring and reporting of NetFlow data desirable Experience conducting network lab tests and simulating network environments Minimal travel anticipated for this position Legal right to work in the United States. Discovery Communications, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Discovery is committed to being an employer of choice, not just a good place to work, but a great and inclusive place to work. To that end, we strive to recruit and maintain a workforce that meaningfully represents the diverse and culturally rich communities that we serve. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disabled status or, genetic information. We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws, including but not limited to all local Fair Chance Ordinances. EEO is the Law Pay Transparency Policy Statement California Job Applicant Privacy Policy If you are an individual with a disability and need an accommodation during the application process, please send an email request to HR@discovery.com.
html_job_description:
Discovery hires the very best and brightest talent who are enthusiastic and passionate to fulfill the company’s mission of empowering people to explore their world and satisfy their curiosity.

In exchange for their talent and drive, employees are provided with an engaging, diverse workplace and the resources they need to learn, thrive and grow in their careers.

Job Summary

The Network Engineer will be responsible for working with the operations and engineering teams around the strategic, tactical, and improvement of the global network platforms. The individual will be evaluating processes regularly to ensure expected outcomes are achieved in the most efficient way along with identifying service improvements and document those improvements. Help ensure standards and processes are followed.

Key Responsibilities
  • Effectively support all DCI network infrastructure 24*7 by responding to and resolving all trouble tickets within the stipulated SLA time – 40%
  • Clearly understand the root cause of all the network outages and take remediation steps to prevent the recurrence of the problem – 10%
  • Ability to prioritize work based on business criticalities and also be flexible to work on ad hoc tasks as assigned by the manager – 20%
  • Fully understand and adhere to the team’s network standards and procedures both in technical and functional areas – 20%
  • Maintain positive relationships with all user communities, peers and the management team – 10%
  • Perform other duties as needed.
Requirements
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems or similar
  • Minimum of 5 years of experience in system administration in an enterprise production environment
  • Strong skills with OSPF and BGP routing protocols
  • Strong skills with DNS, DHCP, and IPAM platforms
  • Strong skills with Juniper and Cisco routing and switching platforms
  • Strong skills with Cisco and/or Aruba wireless platforms
  • Strong skills with F5 and Netscaler load balancer platforms
  • Understanding of Juniper SRX, Cisco, and Palo Alto firewall platforms
  • Understanding of remote access and VPN technologies
  • Understanding of MPLS networks
  • Understanding of Aruba Clearpass or similar AAA platforms
  • Understanding of network security protocols, standards and policies
  • Understanding and experience with IP Telephony
  • Understanding of wireless networking protocols and standards
  • Understanding of WAN Optimization Technologies
  • Process oriented engineer with strong execution and follow-through skills
  • Able to perform multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize self
  • Strong and consistent customer service and communication skills
  • Willingness to work a flexible schedule and participate in on-call duties
