job_description: Summary Are you excited by the idea of building foundational technology that unlocks the creativity of Apple developers? Do you have an interest or passion for computer graphics or the Augmented Reality space? Do you enjoy working in highly collaborative environments with cross disciplinary teams? The RealityKit framework team inside the Technology Development Group (TDG) is seeking a passionate software engineer to help push our rendering and simulation technologies to the forefront of the Augmented Reality space. You will play a critical role in shaping of our public framework, while also contributing heavily to upcoming features that will enable Apple developers to build amazing and creative AR content and experiences. Key Qualifications Knowledge of Apple UI Frameworks (e.g. AppKit, UIKit, and SwiftUI) Proficient in a systems programming language like C/C++, Objective-C, or Swift. Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills. Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with technical and non-technical teams. Description The ideal engineer enjoys working in a collaborative and highly creative environment while exploring the rapidly evolving AR domain. You will work in a tight knit team which is focused on developing cutting-edge rendering technology within the RealityKit framework. As a framework engineer on our team, you will work up and down our software stack, ranging from shaping our developer facing Swift APIs to interfacing with our low level rendering pipeline. You will also work closely with cross-functional partner teams, helping breakdown their requirements, prototype ideas, and build applications that demonstrate the capabilities that you've built. Education & Experience Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience Additional Requirements - Experience using Apple's graphics APIs and frameworks, e.g. Core Animation, Core Graphics, metal. - Background in 3D rendering is a plus Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Apple is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Apple is a drug-free workplace
html_job_description:
Summary
Are you excited by the idea of building foundational technology that unlocks the creativity of Apple developers? Do you have an interest or passion for computer graphics or the Augmented Reality space? Do you enjoy working in highly collaborative environments with cross disciplinary teams?


The RealityKit framework team inside the Technology Development Group (TDG) is seeking a passionate software engineer to help push our rendering and simulation technologies to the forefront of the Augmented Reality space. You will play a critical role in shaping of our public framework, while also contributing heavily to upcoming features that will enable Apple developers to build amazing and creative AR content and experiences.


Key Qualifications
Knowledge of Apple UI Frameworks (e.g. AppKit, UIKit, and SwiftUI)

Proficient in a systems programming language like C/C++, Objective-C, or Swift.

Excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills.

Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate with technical and non-technical teams.


Description
The ideal engineer enjoys working in a collaborative and highly creative environment while exploring the rapidly evolving AR domain. You will work in a tight knit team which is focused on developing cutting-edge rendering technology within the RealityKit framework.


As a framework engineer on our team, you will work up and down our software stack, ranging from shaping our developer facing Swift APIs to interfacing with our low level rendering pipeline.


You will also work closely with cross-functional partner teams, helping breakdown their requirements, prototype ideas, and build applications that demonstrate the capabilities that you've built.


Education & Experience
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience


Additional Requirements
- Experience using Apple's graphics APIs and frameworks, e.g. Core Animation, Core Graphics, metal.

- Background in 3D rendering is a plus


Apple is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We take affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity for all applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, Veteran status, or other legally protected characteristics. Apple is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Apple is a drug-free workplace

Job SummaryResponsible for analysis, installation and administration of Applications, servers, systems and PCs.Job Description
LOCATION

9800 S Monroe St

Sandy, UT 84070

SCHEDULE

Full-time

To be effective, an individual must be able to perform each job duty successfully.
  • Primarily responsible for managing client endpoint devices with a mix of operating systems including Windows 10, MacOS, iOS, and Android.
  • Maintains and suggests technical training to further expand knowledge of installed technologies while providing timely, accurate, and professional service.
  • Plans, installs, upgrades, administers, and troubleshoots PC/networked based hardware and software platforms.
  • Provides Level 3 support for end user technology issues.
  • Strong Application packaging and deployment experience using Ivanti Endpoint Manager (formerly Landesk Management Suite), SCCM, etc.
  • Architects, deploys, and manages server infrastructure relating to Endpoint Services.
  • Develops and maintains user guides, diagrams, and procedures for technical functions and services.
  • Performs other duties as assigned

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, And ABILITIES

The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions.

Experience

7+ years supporting Windows client operating systems including installation, configuration, troubleshooting, serviceability, and problem resolution. Deployment automation knowledge a plus using Autopilot and WCD toolsets.

5+ years’ experience as a system administrator in an Enterprise managing Windows / Active Directory / MDM / EMM (Intune) environments.

Extensive experience and knowledge of the following technologies: Microsoft Windows client and server Operating Systems, Apple MacOS/iOS, Android, Microsoft Active Directory, Microsoft Intune, Group Policies, Ivanti Endpoint Manager / LANDesk Management Suite, VMware ESX Server Virtualization, network/server design and topology.

Credit Union Or Banking Experience Preferred.

Strong scripting experience required (PowerShell preferred).

Education

Four-year college degree or equivalent

Certifications Preferred But Not Required

Computer/Office Equipment Skills

Azure Active Directory working knowledge including Conditional Access policies and Intune Configuration Service Provider (CSP) policies.

Possesses a strong knowledge of using Microsoft Desktop Analytics for system baselining and visibility into system health for realizing optimal performance and standardization of Corporate Laptop Fleet (Microsoft Surface).

Advanced skills in Microsoft Office including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel

Managerial Responsibility

Has no supervisory/managerial responsibilities

Other Skills And Abilities

Strong customer service skills and the ability to prioritize, organize, and effectively communicate are required.

PHYSICAL ABILITIES / WORKING CONDITIONS

Physical Demands

Ability to sit, talk, and hear consistently

Ability to kneel, crouch or crawl, and use hands to handle or reach frequently

Ability to stand and walk occasionally

Vision Requirements

Closer vision (clear vision at 20 inches or less)

Distant vision (clear vision at 20 feet or more)

Color vision (ability to identify and distinguish colors)

Ability to adjust focus (ability to adjust the eye to bring an object into sharp focus)

Weight Lifted or Force Exerted

Ability to lift up to 10 pounds consistently

Ability to lift up to 50 pounds occasionally

Environmental

Must be able to endure cold non-weather conditions occasionally.

Noise Environment

Moderate noise (business office with computers and printers, light traffic)

Mountain America Credit Union is an EEO/AA/ADA/Veterans employer.

job_description: If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates. Requisition ID: 63095 Job Description Responsibilities: RFIC Design Engineer: responsible for the design and development of RFICs for mobile handset applications. The candidate will work with a group of analog/RF IC design experts in development of cellular-band ICs that transmit, receive, and/or switch signal to or from antennas. The candidate will interface with design management and module design teams to create the detailed specification, report design progress, and to collect, track, and resolve any performance and circuit design issues. #LI-DB1 Qualifications and Education Requirements: The candidate must be experienced in transistor-level LNA or RF switch design in Si-based technology. He or she must understand the basic device physics, have the ability to develop and use advanced linear and nonlinear models or simulation techniques and be able to translate between the model, simulation, physical implementation, and the measured performance of a device. Good RF and microwave engineering knowledge is required in order to optimize RF performance of the RFIC. This job also requires experience in simulation tools, analog and RF circuit test characterization techniques and equipment. He or she must have good communication skills, be able to break down complex problems, set priorities, report progress, execute to a schedule, and have strong people skills. Preferred Skills: The candidate should possess the following degree and years of related industrial experience: BS + 5 years, MS + 3 years, or PhD. The candidate should also have expert-level experience in using ADS or Cadence IC design tools and hands-on experience with lab measurements and characterization equipment. About Business Unit: The Mobile Solutions (MSB) team at Skyworks develops industry-leading, highly integrated solutions for next generation mobile platforms supporting the world’s leading smartphone manufacturers. Our design engineers have diverse expertise and utilize a broad range of technologies (SOI, silicon CMOS, GaAs, IPD, TC-SAW and pHEMT) to create differentiated transmit and receive products including high performance LNAs, couplers, power amplifiers, antenna switch modules, digital/analog controllers, passive matching and acoustic filtering for leading edge 3GPP standards. Skyworks’ MSB team is an ideal place for motivated engineers who enjoy collaboration in a fast-paced environment and designing industry breakthrough solutions for mobile and 5G applications. Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Nearest Major Market: Ventura Nearest Secondary Market: Oxnard Job Segment: Design Engineer, Engineer, Network, Telecom, Telecommunications, Engineering, Technology

  • Research new technologies and solutions.

Minimum qualifications:

  • Hands-on software development experience using Java, .NET, Python or other 3rd Gen programming languages - min 2-3 years
  • A leader who has led a team for developing software applications for 2-3 years
  • Delivered a large enterprise-scale application. Must include mobile deployment as well
  • Excellent customer engagement skills
  • User-focused with a knack for user experience
  • Good knowledge of old and new technologies (Programming languages, DevOps, Blockchain, AI/ML, etc.)

Responsible for total support of day to day incidents, operations, and other various services by supplying Level 3 expertise and direction. This role serves as an escalation point for the most difficult and complex technical opportunities

Responsibilities:

Leads problem recognition, research, isolation, resolution and follow-up for the most complex technical and security opportunities across multiple businesses and diverse systems

Systems monitoring and support for mission critical applications and processes

Lead role on multiple complex projects

Analyze and identify trends in issue reporting and devising preventive solutions

Responsible for the installation, configuration, and ongoing usability of computers, peripheral equipment, networks, file shares, software, and mobile devices as well as other assigned projects

Answers, evaluates, and prioritizes incoming telephone, voice mail, e-mail, in-person, and ticket system requests for assistance from users experiencing problems with hardware, software, networking, and other computer-related technologies

Interviews user to collect information about problem and leads user through diagnostic procedures to determine source of error

Handles problem recognition, research, isolation, resolution and follow-up for the most complex opportunities

Logs and tracks calls and maintains history records and related problem documentation

Communicates with software and hardware vendors to request solutions regarding defective products and new services

Support monthly maintenance window activities as needed

Responsible for ensuring asset records are accurate and up-to-date

Collaborates with Service Desk staff and end-users to resolve high priority trouble tickets and support junior engineers to quickly identify and resolve tickets

Education and Skillset:

Bachelor's Degree required

Industry certifications preferred

5+ years of relevant IT experience

Experience in supporting distributed systems and/or businesses

5+ years of experience in a hardware/software support role on both networks and PCs

In depth knowledge of Windows server and desktop operating systems

Strong analytical and critical thinking skills

Ability to identify and communicate root cause of network, software, and printing problems

Ability to quickly research, learn and support new technologies, applications, and processes

Must be self-motivated and able to work with minimal supervision

Able to resolve LAN, WAN and VPN network connection issues and possesses a solid understanding of networking

concepts

Must have strong organizational skills, attention to detail, ability to multi-task, work well on a team, and maintain professionalism at all times in a fast paced environment

This position is for the 10:00 AM - 7:30 PM shift.

job_description: Reynolds and Reynolds is looking for creative individuals who are driven to produce great software solutions. job_description: Who We Are: We reward shoppers for digitizing their shopping experience. Our mission is to delight the world’s shoppers with a free smartphone app that is easy, smart and fun. Why Join the Fetch Family? We make it better for users even when that's difficult for us We empower people with information and trust We challenge ideas, not people We think bigger and keep building We find ways to bring the fun to Fetch! We're committed to building an empowered and inclusive community of innovative and passionate people. As a growing organization, we need team players who can go above and beyond their individual responsibilities to help our company build towards its vision. If you are a creative, hard-working, and fun-seeking person interested in working with a close-knit group of highly talented people, this is the right place for you. Fetch Rewards is an equal employment opportunity employer. At Fetch Rewards, our vision is to help people digitize their shopping in a way that is fun and rewarding. Millions of people use our app every month and we are growing rapidly. Headquartered in Madison, WI with offices in Chicago, San Francisco, and New York, we pride ourselves on two things – speed and excellence. The DataOps team embodies these values and works with a laser focused objective to enable data driven services and analytics for end users, internal stakeholders, and external partners. We are looking for a Data Engineer to contribute to this vision and reap the rewards of joining an exciting company in the high growth phase. Your focus will be on developing pipeline frameworks, micro-services, and data solutions that can scale to match the company’s growth trajectory. We don't lock ourselves into particular technologies, but some we are currently using include AWS, Snowflake, Python, Spark, Lambda, CloudFormation, Docker, Kinesis, MongoDB, and Tableau. You’ll also get to join a team of talented individuals who will provide you with hands-on mentorship on topics ranging from engineering to DevOps to analytics. Success in this role requires the ability to analyze challenging problems, propose solutions under the guidance of experienced teammates, and implement designs within timeframes that keep up with business needs. You possess: Excellent Python or JavaScript (NodeJS) programming skills Solid SQL skills Familiarity with Unix systems, shell scripting, and Git Experience with relational (SQL), non-relational (NoSQL), and/or object data stores (e.g., Snowflake, MongoDB, S3, HDFS, Postgres, Redis, DynamoDB) Interest in building and experimenting with different tools and tech, and sharing your learnings with the broader organization The desire to work with other teams in the organization (e.g., Development, Business Intelligence, Data Science) to build tools and solutions that support and help manage data within the Fetch ecosystem Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science (or equivalent) At least 2 years of relevant full-time work experience Bonus points for: Excellent written and verbal communication skills Familiarity with open source software and dependency management ETL process, data pipeline, and/or micro-service development experience Cloud engineering and DevOps skills (e.g., AWS, CloudFormation, Docker) Familiarity with messaging and asynchronous technologies (e.g., SQS, Kinesis, RabbitMQ, Kafka) Big data development skills (e.g., Spark, Hadoop, MPP DW) Experience with visualization tools (e.g., Tableau) Love of Dogs! . . . Or just tolerance. html_job_description:
Who We Are:

We reward shoppers for digitizing their shopping experience. 
Our mission is to delight the world’s shoppers with a free smartphone app that is easy, smart and fun.

Why Join the Fetch Family?

We make it better for users even when that's difficult for us
We empower people with information and trust
We challenge ideas, not people
We think bigger and keep building
We find ways to bring the fun to Fetch!

We're committed to building an empowered and inclusive community of innovative and passionate people. As a growing organization, we need team players who can go above and beyond their individual responsibilities to help our company build towards its vision. If you are a creative, hard-working, and fun-seeking person interested in working with a close-knit group of highly talented people, this is the right place for you.

Fetch Rewards is an equal employment opportunity employer.

At Fetch Rewards, our vision is to help people digitize their shopping in a way that is fun and rewarding. Millions of people use our app every month and we are growing rapidly. Headquartered in Madison, WI with offices in Chicago, San Francisco, and New York, we pride ourselves on two things – speed and excellence.

The DataOps team embodies these values and works with a laser focused objective to enable data driven services and analytics for end users, internal stakeholders, and external partners. We are looking for a Data Engineer to contribute to this vision and reap the rewards of joining an exciting company in the high growth phase.

Your focus will be on developing pipeline frameworks, micro-services, and data solutions that can scale to match the company’s growth trajectory. We don't lock ourselves into particular technologies, but some we are currently using include AWS, Snowflake, Python, Spark, Lambda, CloudFormation, Docker, Kinesis, MongoDB, and Tableau. You’ll also get to join a team of talented individuals who will provide you with hands-on mentorship on topics ranging from engineering to DevOps to analytics. Success in this role requires the ability to analyze challenging problems, propose solutions under the guidance of experienced teammates, and implement designs within timeframes that keep up with business needs.



You possess:

  • Excellent Python or JavaScript (NodeJS) programming skills
  • Solid SQL skills
  • Familiarity with Unix systems, shell scripting, and Git
  • Experience with relational (SQL), non-relational (NoSQL), and/or object data stores (e.g., Snowflake, MongoDB, S3, HDFS, Postgres, Redis, DynamoDB)
  • Interest in building and experimenting with different tools and tech, and sharing your learnings with the broader organization
  • The desire to work with other teams in the organization (e.g., Development, Business Intelligence, Data Science) to build tools and solutions that support and help manage data within the Fetch ecosystem
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science (or equivalent)
  • At least 2 years of relevant full-time work experience


Bonus points for:

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Familiarity with open source software and dependency management
  • ETL process, data pipeline, and/or micro-service development experience
  • Cloud engineering and DevOps skills (e.g., AWS, CloudFormation, Docker)
  • Familiarity with messaging and asynchronous technologies (e.g., SQS, Kinesis, RabbitMQ, Kafka)
  • Big data development skills (e.g., Spark, Hadoop, MPP DW)
  • Experience with visualization tools (e.g., Tableau)
  • Love of Dogs! . . . Or just tolerance. We're a very canine-friendly workplace
 

Recommended skills

Apache Hadoop
Mongo Db
Big Data
Hadoop Distributed File System
Data Pipeline
Redis

job_description: POSITION OVERVIEW: The Support Engineer is a member of the Remote Support Team. Our primary focus is on timely and successful delivery of remote IT support services to the company’s clients, most of whom are in the Biotech/Pharma sector. Responsibilities: Action issue/request tickets assigned from our incoming queue Answer phones to assist clients who call in directly Address notifications, alerts, and pages during business hours Process tickets in accordance with established company/client SOPs Update documentation when necessary Participate in company’s “on-call” rotation Qualifications: Excellent Customer service skills are required Excellent follow up skills and commitment to above average customer satisfaction are required 3+ years of IT Windows/Mac support experience in an Enterprise (and home!) environment, including: OS issues, VPN, networking, hardware (and RMA’s), virus/malware, and computer build/configuration Experience with O365 Admin, and O365 applications (incl. MS Teams) Knowledge of Microsoft Infrastructure products and Active Directory Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills Strong attention to detail, strong follow through and follow up on tasks and tickets Certification is preferred (CompTIA, MS, Apple, Google, etc.) Experience with any of the following an advantage: Egnyte, Mimecast, Druva, Meraki, IT Glue, ConnectWise (Manage/Automate/BrightGauge), Sophos, SharePoint, Scientific applications (esp. ChemDraw, PRISM, GraphPad, PyMOL), Domain management, AV (esp. Zoom), iOS. Experience with Creativity – finding a way to side-step problems by coming up with radical solution Working Conditions: 8:00 am – 4:30 pm but extended hours are needed from time to time. Must be willing to work after hours when needed to complete business critical tasks. Job Type: Full-time How to Apply Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by sending their resume and cover letter to careers@dataev.com.
html_job_description:
POSITION OVERVIEW:

The Support Engineer is a member of the Remote Support Team. Our primary focus is on timely and successful delivery of remote IT support services to the company’s clients, most of whom are in the Biotech/Pharma sector.

Responsibilities:

  • Action issue/request tickets assigned from our incoming queue
  • Answer phones to assist clients who call in directly
  • Address notifications, alerts, and pages during business hours
  • Process tickets in accordance with established company/client SOPs
  • Update documentation when necessary
  • Participate in company’s “on-call” rotation

Qualifications:

  • Excellent Customer service skills are required
  • Excellent follow up skills and commitment to above average customer satisfaction are required
  • 3+ years of IT Windows/Mac support experience in an Enterprise (and home!) environment, including: OS issues, VPN, networking, hardware (and RMA’s), virus/malware, and computer build/configuration
  • Experience with O365 Admin, and O365 applications (incl. MS Teams)
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Infrastructure products and Active Directory
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills
  • Strong attention to detail, strong follow through and follow up on tasks and tickets
  • Certification is preferred (CompTIA, MS, Apple, Google, etc.)
  • Experience with any of the following an advantage: Egnyte, Mimecast, Druva, Meraki, IT Glue, ConnectWise (Manage/Automate/BrightGauge), Sophos, SharePoint, Scientific applications (esp. ChemDraw, PRISM, GraphPad, PyMOL), Domain management, AV (esp. Zoom), iOS.
  • Experience with Creativity – finding a way to side-step problems by coming up with radical solution

Working Conditions: 8:00 am – 4:30 pm but extended hours are needed from time to time. Must be willing to work after hours when needed to complete business critical tasks.

Job Type: Full-time


How to Apply

Qualified candidates are encouraged to apply by sending their resume and cover letter to careers@dataev.com.

job_description: About GM There’s never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors. To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won’t happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future. Why Work for Us Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities. Job Description In recent years, GM Information Technology has successfully executed the largest IT transformation in the history of the automotive industry, fully insourcing what once was a nearly completely outsourced IT function. Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops and maintains all IT infrastructure, applications and solutions enabling GM’s global operations. From designing and building the next generation of electric and other vehicles to developing a world-class GM experience for our dealers and customers, GM IT is driving real change in the most iconic automaker on the planet. Our team delivers unique enterprise-wide IT solutions in cutting-edge technologies such as mobility, telematics, mission-critical business systems, supercomputing, cloud, vehicle engineering and real-time computing. We offer challenging positions for passionate professionals looking to advance their careers and be a part of an IT organization focused on innovation, speed and business value. We are seeking an experienced Business Intelligence Developer to join our Finance Analytics – CONNECT/VPxVIN team. In this role you will collaborate with Finance business stakeholders and IT teams to develop analytics and visualizations that improve efficiency and effectiveness of incentive spending and go-to market strategies. Through analytics solutions, you will take part in solving business problems that can be operationalized to drive tangible business value. Job Responsibilities Deliver data-driven insights and ‘tell the story’ that enables strategic and operational decisions Translate business requirements into technical requirements to implement BI solutions Understand & research the limitations of BI tools to ensure the best tool is used for solutioning Support analytical projects from conception to completion with high velocity and quality, be cognizant of status, roadblocks and pace of project throughout and escalate as necessary to ensure success and on-time delivery to business partners Provide task-level estimated effort and development schedules to project leads Develop and deploy visualizations with industry leading BI tools, using Power BI, Cognos, Tableau Thrive in a collaborative atmosphere and believe in the power of innovation through differing viewpoints Qualifications Bachelor's degree in computer science, management information systems, or related discipline 3-5 years' experience in data visualization and advance calculations (Aggregate, Date, Logical, String, Table) using Azure-based Power BI Knowledge on connecting Microsoft Azure-based Power BI to various data sources Expert creating different visualizations using Slicers, Lines, Pies, Histograms, Maps, Scatter, Bullets, Heat Maps, Tree maps, etc. Experience with Microsoft Business Intelligence Suite (Microsoft SSAS, SSRS and SSIS) and Power BI Strong applied knowledge of data, transformation and analysis using varying techniques Moderate to advanced SQL skills Able to implement row level security on data and understanding of application security layer models in Power BI Able to optimize performance where required Experience developing in Agile SCRUM teams Additional Job Description Preferred Requirements: Accounting or Financial Experience Experience in creating DAX expressions/Power Query Tableau and Cognos experience is a plus Understanding of SAP HANA database and how to connect with Power BI Familiarity with programming languages (Java, Python, C++) Benefits Overview The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others: Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents; Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family; Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement; Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values; Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing; Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends. Diversity Information General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.
html_job_description:
About GM

There’s never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.

To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won’t happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.

Why Work for Us

Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.

Job Description

In recent years, GM Information Technology has successfully executed the largest IT transformation in the history of the automotive industry, fully insourcing what once was a nearly completely outsourced IT function. Today GM IT is a dynamic and fast paced organization that designs, develops and maintains all IT infrastructure, applications and solutions enabling GM’s global operations. From designing and building the next generation of electric and other vehicles to developing a world-class GM experience for our dealers and customers, GM IT is driving real change in the most iconic automaker on the planet. Our team delivers unique enterprise-wide IT solutions in cutting-edge technologies such as mobility, telematics, mission-critical business systems, supercomputing, cloud, vehicle engineering and real-time computing. We offer challenging positions for passionate professionals looking to advance their careers and be a part of an IT organization focused on innovation, speed and business value.

We are seeking an experienced Business Intelligence Developer to join our Finance Analytics – CONNECT/VPxVIN team. In this role you will collaborate with Finance business stakeholders and IT teams to develop analytics and visualizations that improve efficiency and effectiveness of incentive spending and go-to market strategies. Through analytics solutions, you will take part in solving business problems that can be operationalized to drive tangible business value.

Job Responsibilities
  • Deliver data-driven insights and ‘tell the story’ that enables strategic and operational decisions
  • Translate business requirements into technical requirements to implement BI solutions
  • Understand & research the limitations of BI tools to ensure the best tool is used for solutioning
  • Support analytical projects from conception to completion with high velocity and quality, be cognizant of status, roadblocks and pace of project throughout and escalate as necessary to ensure success and on-time delivery to business partners
  • Provide task-level estimated effort and development schedules to project leads
  • Develop and deploy visualizations with industry leading BI tools, using Power BI, Cognos, Tableau
  • Thrive in a collaborative atmosphere and believe in the power of innovation through differing viewpoints

Qualifications
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, management information systems, or related discipline
  • 3-5 years' experience in data visualization and advance calculations (Aggregate, Date, Logical, String, Table) using Azure-based Power BI
  • Knowledge on connecting Microsoft Azure-based Power BI to various data sources
  • Expert creating different visualizations using Slicers, Lines, Pies, Histograms, Maps, Scatter, Bullets, Heat Maps, Tree maps, etc.
  • Experience with Microsoft Business Intelligence Suite (Microsoft SSAS, SSRS and SSIS) and Power BI
  • Strong applied knowledge of data, transformation and analysis using varying techniques
  • Moderate to advanced SQL skills
  • Able to implement row level security on data and understanding of application security layer models in Power BI
  • Able to optimize performance where required
  • Experience developing in Agile SCRUM teams

Additional Job Description

Preferred Requirements:
  • Accounting or Financial Experience
  • Experience in creating DAX expressions/Power Query
  • Tableau and Cognos experience is a plus
  • Understanding of SAP HANA database and how to connect with Power BI
  • Familiarity with programming languages (Java, Python, C++)

Benefits Overview

The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:

  • Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents;
  • Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family;
  • Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement;
  • Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values;
  • Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing;
  • Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.

    • Diversity Information

    General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

    We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

job_description: Seeking an iOS/macOS developer to join Mimestream's engineering team, an early-stage startup focused on email. In this position, you’ll be an early engineer at our company, and work directly with our founder, who previously worked at Apple managing several software engineering teams. In this environment, you'll have many opportunities for growth, and receive a significant amount of mentorship. You’ll also be a part of a fast-paced, quick-growing company and get to wear many hats along the way. A preview of our debut 1.0 product is available at https://www.mimestream.com, an Gmail client for macOS. We have big long-term plans! Responsibilities and Duties This is a full-time position – 100% remote for now. We may get into an office in the Baltimore suburbs after the pandemic is over, or we may stay 100% remote depending on the hires we make. As part of the Mimestream frameworks engineering team, you will write core application functionality in Swift. You will design APIs, follow a test-driven development methodology, focus on implementing highly efficient code, scaling to large amounts of data, and optimizing for performance. Required Skills Strong communication skills in English. A great sense of visual design and attention to detail. Expert-level knowledge of the Swift and Objective-C programming languages. Expert-level knowledge of Cocoa frameworks such as AppKit, Core Data and Foundation. Experience with SwiftUI preferred Strong knowledge of computer science fundamentals, such as OOP programming, operating systems, concurrency, and networking. Proficient with source control systems such as Git. Required Education and Experience A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering is required. A Master’s or PhD is a plus. Candidates should have at least 2 years of experience developing iOS or macOS applications. When applying, please include links to any previously published apps. Job Type: Full-time Schedule: Monday to Friday This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is: Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture Innovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativity Company's website: https://mimestream.com COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process
html_job_description:
Seeking an iOS/macOS developer to join Mimestream's engineering team, an early-stage startup focused on email.

In this position, you’ll be an early engineer at our company, and work directly with our founder, who previously worked at Apple managing several software engineering teams. In this environment, you'll have many opportunities for growth, and receive a significant amount of mentorship. You’ll also be a part of a fast-paced, quick-growing company and get to wear many hats along the way.

A preview of our debut 1.0 product is available at https://www.mimestream.com, an Gmail client for macOS. We have big long-term plans!

Responsibilities and Duties

This is a full-time position – 100% remote for now. We may get into an office in the Baltimore suburbs after the pandemic is over, or we may stay 100% remote depending on the hires we make.

As part of the Mimestream frameworks engineering team, you will write core application functionality in Swift. You will design APIs, follow a test-driven development methodology, focus on implementing highly efficient code, scaling to large amounts of data, and optimizing for performance.

Required Skills

  • Strong communication skills in English.
  • A great sense of visual design and attention to detail.
  • Expert-level knowledge of the Swift and Objective-C programming languages.
  • Expert-level knowledge of Cocoa frameworks such as AppKit, Core Data and Foundation.
  • Experience with SwiftUI preferred
  • Strong knowledge of computer science fundamentals, such as OOP programming, operating systems, concurrency, and networking.
  • Proficient with source control systems such as Git.

Required Education and Experience

A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering is required. A Master’s or PhD is a plus.

Candidates should have at least 2 years of experience developing iOS or macOS applications. When applying, please include links to any previously published apps.

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:

  • Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous
  • Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture
  • Innovative -- prefers working in unconventional ways or on tasks that require creativity

Company's website:

  • https://mimestream.com

COVID-19 Precaution(s):

  • Remote interview process

job_description: We are looking for a Duda website expert who can help us evolve and expand our site for a start-up sports media company. This site will require constant updating with new videos, news links, photos, and athlete profiles, and e-commerce capabilities over the course of 2021. The current site was built on the Duda platform (please, don't get us started on WordPress and its stability/security issues). Part of the challenge in the coming months is to determine if Duda is, in fact, the right platform. We want to give it a legitimate shot, but at the moment we are struggling due to our own lack of experience with the editor. Your role will be to partner with our design team to translate their vision and content into a world-class sports-entertainment site. Design skills, as well as a deep proficiency with the platform, are essential. We will be reliant on you to understand how to optimize page layouts for SEO and lighthouse scores, create a highly reliable e-commerce page, and stretch the platform's ability to deliver high quality video highlights and content. Also critical is a willingness to dive in when needed (weekends included), knowing that immediate/time-sensitive changes are sometime necessary. This position has the potential to turn into a full-time job within the next 3 to 6 months, but at this stage is a part-time role. Job Type: Part-time Pay: $50.00 - $75.00 per hour Benefits: Flexible schedule Schedule: On call COVID-19 considerations: This job is fully remote, so there will be no face-to-face interaction. Education: Bachelor's (Preferred) Experience: Web Design: 2 years (Preferred) Duda: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: Fully Remote Hours per week: 10-19 Company's website: ringcityusa.com

job_description: Boeing Intelligence & Analytics (BI&A) is seeking a Full-Stack Software Developers to join the development team on one of our (many) prime programs. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. html_job_description:
Boeing Intelligence & Analytics (BI&A) is seeking a Full-Stack Software Developers to join the development team on one of our (many) prime programs.

Work Location:

Crystal City, VA

What You Will Do

Contribute to the development and deployment of a large data repository and data distribution platform providing foundational infrastructure for a collection of mission-critical government applications that are part of a cloud-based global intelligence gathering and analytics platform.

A Day in the Life: (just a few of the things you will do)
  • Design and implement a data repository and distribution hub for heterogeneous data that can be deployed in both managed and self-managed environment
  • Build UI front ends for data submission and data flow monitoring based on working with the Product Owner and mock-ups
  • Design and develop automation workflows using GitLab CI for unit test, service and application deployments
  • Produce API documentation to include diagrams, referencing dependent services, along with required input and output for each endpoint
​ Required Education / Years of Experience:
  • Bachelor’s degree in a technical discipline from an accredited college or university is required with a minimum of 3 years of development experience.
Required Experience/ Skills: (must have)
  • An Active TS/SCI clearance
  • 3 + years of Java
  • Hands on experience or familiarity with Linux CLI Use and Git
  • Experience building “Modern” web interfaces using HTML and JavaScript Frameworks (Angular, React or Vue
  • Agile/ Scrum experience
  • CI/CD tool experience
  • AWS and/or C2S experience
Desired Experience/ Skills: (nice to have)
  • ReactJS experience and/or understanding
  • SQL and PostgreSQL familiarity and/or experience
  • Experience building and deploying Docker-based applications
  • Knowledge of or experience with Kubernetes

BI&A is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

job_description: J5 Consulting is a Maryland based company established in 2006 to provide computing and consulting services for government and commercial entities. Our services improve Information System networking performance and compliance, and protect electronic assets from loss and compromise. We welcome your application to receive consideration for the following position. This position requires an active TS/SCI clearance and full scope polygraph. Job Qualifications Required Skills Demonstrated experience developing network design solutions (physical and logical) in compliance with best engineering practices, standards, and guidelines. Demonstrated experience writing system requirements and relevant network documentation, and Demonstrated experience working with others to determine network requirements. Demonstrated hands-on experience installing, configuring, troubleshooting, and maintaining network services, equipment and devices, such as Switches, Routers, Servers, Cables, Racks, and Firewalls. Demonstrated expertise with hands-on experience developing and sustaining a wireless network infrastructure. Demonstrated experience using Information Assurance concepts such as encryption techniques (e.g. AES/DES) and IPSec protocols (e.g., IKE and ISAKMP). Demonstrated experience applying rigorous System Engineering practice to requirement flow-down and Verification & Validation (V&V). Demonstrated experience providing technical support for briefings to high level staff and Demonstrated experience briefing various degrees of technical information to a range of audiences. Demonstrated experience managing competing priorities, risks, and mitigation. Demonstrated experience participating in technical exchange meetings. Desired Skills Demonstrated written and communication skills. Demonstrated experience administering the sponsor’s IT systems. Demonstrated experience providing IT support at all tiers Demonstrated experience supporting interconnectivity between Information Systems (e.g., Wireless Architecture) & IT management tools (e.g., Splunk). Demonstrated experience collaborating with other organizations’ contractor staff. Demonstrated experience working in agile environment. Demonstrated experience using Autocad Demonstrated expertise designing and implementing commercial grade Wi-Fi technologies Demonstrated expertise designing efficient wireless access point solutions for an enterprise environment. Demonstrated expertise maintaining an awareness of commercial wireless access point products across multiple vendors. Demonstrated experience with Windows, Linux, and AWS platform environments. Desired Certifications: CCNA CCNP CCIE ACMA ACMP ACMX Applying for this Position Send an updated resume to careers@j5consulting.co (refer to the job title and job ID) We will evaluate your submission, provide a response and an Employment Application as needed Complete and return the Employment Application promptly Receive updates as to the status of your application J5 Consulting offers excellent benefits and compensation packages. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing fair and equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran or military status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

Job Description

Title: DevOps Engineer

Expected contract duration: 12 months

Location: Conway AR 72034

DevOps Engineers is responsible for designing and building flexible infrastructure and automation solutions that will allow our teams to work faster, more efficiently and more productively. DevOps Engineer will collaborate with software developers, system operators and other IT staff members to manage development or deployment processes productively. Responsible for multitasking and dealing with multiple urgent situations at a time, the Devops Engineers must be extremely flexible.

job_description: Summary Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Dynamic, smart people and inspiring, innovative technologies are the norm here. The people who work here have reinvented entire industries with all Apple Hardware products. The same passion for innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices strengthening our commitment to leave the world better than we found it. Join us to help deliver the next groundbreaking Apple product. Do you love working on challenges that no one has solved yet? As a member of our dynamic group, you will have the unique and rewarding opportunity to craft upcoming products that will delight and inspire millions of Apple’s customers every single day. Do you love creating elegant solutions to highly complex challenges? Do you intrinsically see the importance in every detail? As part of our Silicon Technologies group, you’ll help design and manufacture our next-generation, high-performance, power-efficient processor, system-on-chip (SoC). You’ll ensure Apple products and services can seamlessly and expertly handle the tasks that make them beloved by millions. Joining this group means you’ll be crafting and building the technology that fuels Apple’s devices. Together, we will enable our customers to do all the things they love with their devices. At Apple, we push our designs to the limit in order to make amazing products. We want to delight our customers with hardware that performs extraordinary while delivering industry leading features. As part of the mobile GPU design team, you will work with Platform Architecture, Software, Design Verification, Implementation and other design teams to support the delivery of RTL for GPU. Key Qualifications Proven expertise in GPU, CPU, or SOC Proficiency in System Verilog, scripting languages (Perl/Ruby/Python), programming languages (C, C++), and revision control systems Efficient with simulation and debugging tools Knowledge of GPU, CPU, and/or DSP Architecture and micro-architecture Ability to close performance, power, area, functionality and lint for designs Ability to work well in a team and be productive under aggressive schedules Description You will have experience with RTL Top-level assembly and triage of GPU designs You will run logic equivalence checking during different stages of the design phase You will deliver high quality RTL to the graphics team Review and signoff specifications for customers and IP providers You will have the ability to collaborate effectively with IP teams spanning multiple sites Provide schedules to IP teams and management Education & Experience BS/MS CE or EE
html_job_description:
Summary
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. Dynamic, smart people and inspiring, innovative technologies are the norm here. The people who work here have reinvented entire industries with all Apple Hardware products. The same passion for innovation that goes into our products also applies to our practices strengthening our commitment to leave the world better than we found it. Join us to help deliver the next groundbreaking Apple product. Do you love working on challenges that no one has solved yet? As a member of our dynamic group, you will have the unique and rewarding opportunity to craft upcoming products that will delight and inspire millions of Apple’s customers every single day.


Do you love creating elegant solutions to highly complex challenges? Do you intrinsically see the importance in every detail? As part of our Silicon Technologies group, you’ll help design and manufacture our next-generation, high-performance, power-efficient processor, system-on-chip (SoC). You’ll ensure Apple products and services can seamlessly and expertly handle the tasks that make them beloved by millions. Joining this group means you’ll be crafting and building the technology that fuels Apple’s devices. Together, we will enable our customers to do all the things they love with their devices.


At Apple, we push our designs to the limit in order to make amazing products. We want to delight our customers with hardware that performs extraordinary while delivering industry leading features. As part of the mobile GPU design team, you will work with Platform Architecture, Software, Design Verification, Implementation and other design teams to support the delivery of RTL for GPU.


Key Qualifications
Proven expertise in GPU, CPU, or SOC

Proficiency in System Verilog, scripting languages (Perl/Ruby/Python), programming languages (C, C++), and revision control systems

Efficient with simulation and debugging tools

Knowledge of GPU, CPU, and/or DSP Architecture and micro-architecture

Ability to close performance, power, area, functionality and lint for designs

Ability to work well in a team and be productive under aggressive schedules


Description
You will have experience with RTL Top-level assembly and triage of GPU designs


You will run logic equivalence checking during different stages of the design phase


You will deliver high quality RTL to the graphics team


Review and signoff specifications for customers and IP providers


You will have the ability to collaborate effectively with IP teams spanning multiple sites


Provide schedules to IP teams and management


Education & Experience
BS/MS CE or EE

job_description: At Northwestern Medicine, every patient interaction makes a difference in cultivating a positive workplace. This patient-first approach is what sets us apart as a leader in the healthcare industry. As an integral part of our team, you'll have the opportunity to join our quest for better healthcare, no matter where you work within the Northwestern Medicine system. At Northwestern Medicine, we pride ourselves on providing competitive benefits: from tuition reimbursement and loan forgiveness to 401(k) matching and lifecycle benefits, we take care of our employees. Ready to join our quest for better? Job Description The Supply Chain Performance Engineer reflects the mission, vision, and values of NM, adheres to the organizations Code of Ethics and Corporate Compliance Program, and complies with all relevant policies, procedures, guidelines and all other regulatory and accreditation standards. Responsibilities: Assists in the creation and implementation of strategic standardized supply chain processes throughout the health system. Assists supply chain health system teams in the creation of standard processes and standard work. Identifies and deploys best in class supply chain technologies in a standardized manner throughout the health system. Assists teams that perform 5S events and set the foundation to sustain using audits, standard work, KPIs and teaching Managing for Daily Improvement. Assists in the creation new department and new hospital on-boarding programs to ensure smooth and successful transitions of departments and organizations into the health system supply chain model. Assists in the creation of analytical tools for hospital managers to ensure inventory levels are being optimized. Analyzes and interprets various sets of financial, statistical, and managerial data and formulates recommendations. Assists in the creation of optimal and standardized practices for off-site clinics and courier services. All other duties as assigned. AA/EOE. Qualifications Required: Bachelors degree (preferably in Business, Finance, Accounting, Management Engineering, Hospital Administration or related field) or Six Sigma/Lean Black Belt or equivalent work experience. Minimum three (3) years of experience preferably in Supply Chain Operations (purchasing, inventory, distribution, accounts payable), in a multi-site healthcare setting. Excellent computer skills and data management in operation systems and standard application software. Solid written and verbal communication skills. Preferred: Masters degree in Business, Finance, Accounting, Management Engineering, Hospital Administration or other related field. Additional Information Northwestern Medicine is an affirmative action/equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in hiring or employment on the basis of age, sex, race, color, religion, national origin, gender identity, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation or any other protected status.

job_description: Job Description Essential Job Functions Codes, tests, debugs, implements, and documents programs. Assists in the modification of company products and/or customer/internal systems to meet the needs of the client and/or end-user. Gathers information from the system, analyzes program and time requirements, and prepares documentation to change existing programs. Researches and analyzes existing systems and program requirements, under periodic supervision. Designs programs for projects or enhancements to existing programs. Writes specifications for programs of low to moderate complexity. Assists in resolving production support problems. Develops and suggests alternative approaches to resolving problems. Develops test plans to verify logic of new or modified programs. Identifies issues as appropriate. Creates appropriate documentation in work assignments such as program code, and technical documentation. Conducts quality assurance activities such as peer reviews. Remains abreast of and researches industry technical trends and new development to maintain current skills and remain current with industry standards. Basic Qualifications Batch (C, C++. SQL, Unix) – 2+ years SDLC – Software Development Lifecycle Strong SQL with both PL-SQL experience – 4+ years UNIX Operating System – 4+ years Databases - Oracle – 4+ years Data warehousing concepts – 4+ years “C” programming concepts – 4+ years Healthcare provider experience preferred Medicaid/MMIS experience preferred Degree or certification preferred Knowledge on TMSIS and DSS modules is a plus. NOTE: This position is available for remote home-based work within the United States.
html_job_description:
Job Description

Essential Job Functions
  • Codes, tests, debugs, implements, and documents programs. Assists in the modification of company products and/or customer/internal systems to meet the needs of the client and/or end-user.
  • Gathers information from the system, analyzes program and time requirements, and prepares documentation to change existing programs.
  • Researches and analyzes existing systems and program requirements, under periodic supervision.
  • Designs programs for projects or enhancements to existing programs.
  • Writes specifications for programs of low to moderate complexity.
  • Assists in resolving production support problems. Develops and suggests alternative approaches to resolving problems.
  • Develops test plans to verify logic of new or modified programs. Identifies issues as appropriate.
  • Creates appropriate documentation in work assignments such as program code, and technical documentation.
  • Conducts quality assurance activities such as peer reviews.
  • Remains abreast of and researches industry technical trends and new development to maintain current skills and remain current with industry standards.

Basic Qualifications
  • Batch (C, C++. SQL, Unix) – 2+ years
  • SDLC – Software Development Lifecycle
  • Strong SQL with both PL-SQL experience – 4+ years
  • UNIX Operating System – 4+ years
  • Databases - Oracle – 4+ years
  • Data warehousing concepts – 4+ years
  • “C” programming concepts – 4+ years
  • Healthcare provider experience preferred
  • Medicaid/MMIS experience preferred
  • Degree or certification preferred

Knowledge on TMSIS and DSS modules is a plus.

NOTE: This position is available for remote home-based work within the United States.

job_description: AVAJEN is a business-to-business IT service provider that provides design, implementation and support for high-tech systems for businesses in the greater Denver area and remotely across the country. We’re not just aiming to be another outsourced IT service provider. Leveraging over 15 years of experience in some of the country’s most stringent and compliance-bound networks, we’d like to usher in a new era of managed IT services. Our goal is to create environments for small to medium businesses to succeed, removing the common points of failure found in traditional IT networks while remaining simple to use for the businesses we support. AVAJEN is looking to hire a talented and motivated person with a high technical aptitude and experience in the information technology field. The ideal candidate for this position is enthusiastic about technology and enjoys sharing their talent with others. The role involves a mix of technical aptitude and social and communication skills since the majority of the work will be performed directly with clients and clients who may or may not be technical. We’re looking for someone that already possesses experience and knowledge in networking, systems administration, and end-user computing technologies. The ideal candidate should be eager to learn new things on a daily basis. With technology changing so quickly, you’ll need to be a self-starter, learn new technologies quickly, and adapt to new technologies and new security protocols as the industry advances. At AVAJEN our goal is to help people thrive, not just in the work environment but also your home life as well. By balancing onsite work with remote (work-from-home) workloads, we aim to promote a healthy work/life balance. We believe that people who are thriving in all aspects of life, will ultimately do their best work. Essentially, we want you to love your job and love working with our company! This position is located in Denver, Colorado and requires candidates to live locally. Job Description: This position will cross over many skillsets and require knowledge in many facets of IT, including servers, networking, information security, cloud technologies, and End User Computing. Due to the nature of IT, the knowledge required in this position is expected to change frequently and we will all have to adapt to stay ahead of the industry. Below are some of the duties that will be required from this position: Design creative IT solutions to meet the specific needs of our clients while following industry best practices and AVAJEN design standards. Solutions include: Local server and cloud-based solutions for file sharing, email/faxing, user authentication, network and endpoint security, remote access, building management, data backup, End User Computing (EUC) such as VDI EUC environments including full desktop/laptop and VDI/session-based Work with clients onsite to build and manage IT systems and handle End User support requests. Direct interaction with clients means the candidate must have strong inter-personal skills and enjoy working with other people. Work remotely within our ticketing system to resolve reported issues and track project progress. When applicable, work with project managers to keep track of project milestones and timelines. Stay informed with the AVAJEN monitoring system to ensure client network uptime and ultra-fast problem resolution. Work with the AVAJEN IT Revolution team to evaluate the technologies in place as well as new technologies to continuously re-imagine and improve the way we provide IT services. Track all working time in ticketing/billing system Skills and Technologies AVAJEN Systems Engineers need to have a very high aptitude for technology in general and a current working knowledge of a wide variety of existing network and IT system components and concepts. This includes the following: · Desktop and Server Operating Systems o Windows 7 – 10 o Windows Server 2008 – 2019 o MacOS 10.13+ o Linux Variants including Red Hat, Ubuntu, etc. · Server Technologies and Concepts o Active Directory, Azure AD, and similar IDM solutions o Role Based Access Control (RBAC) o Exchange Server/Exchange Online (O365) o File Sharing (SMB, DFS, NFS, etc.) · Cloud Technologies o SharePoint Online o OneDrive o Teams/Skype For Business o Azure and AWS o MDM and EMM platforms such as InTune and AirWatch · Virtualization Technologies o VMware o Hyper-V o Azure and AWS virtual machine infrastructure · Storage Technologies o iSCSI and Fiber Channel SANs o Hyper-Converged Infrastructure o Cloud Storage such as Azure Blob, etc. · Networking Components and Technologies o Firm understanding of the OSI model o Routing and Switching concepts § TCP/IP, STP, NAT, Routing Protocols, VLANs, etc. o Core Network Services § DNS, DHCP, NTP, etc. o Firewall Concepts § Port forwarding (PAT), ACLs, IDP, DPI, etc. o Wireless Network Technologies and concepts § 802.11n,ac,ax § WPA2/3 § Site Survey and Access Point Placement Methodology o Proxy and Reverse Proxy technologies o Load Balancer technologies including DNS based GSLBs such as Traffic Manager · Encryption Technologies for Data in Transit and Data at Rest o VPN (IPSEC and SSL variants) o HTTPS, SSL/TLS o PKI o BitLocker and PGP, Apple APFS with Filevault o TPM 2.0 chips and T2 Chips and what they do · Data Backup and Disaster Recovery Concepts and Strategies o Local backup (Disk or Tape based) o Cloud Backup o Block level vs file level backup o Site replication and failover technologies · Remote Access Solutions o VPN o RDS/Citrix/Horizon This may seem like a big list! The most important thing to us is that you have the aptitude to understand highly technical concepts and the willingness to learn what you don’t know. The vast number of technologies and systems that will come into play for this position will constantly evolve. If you are the right person for the job, this will seem like a fun task! Education and Experience Education specific to the skills required for this position are welcomed and encouraged. This includes college degrees and other forms of formal training in the skillsets listed above. It should be noted that direct experience with these technologies shall be the most important factor in selecting for this position. It is desired for this candidate to have at least 3-5 years of active experience working with the technologies and IT concepts listed above. Certification Industry certifications proving proficiency in any of the above technologies are welcomed and encouraged. Although certifications are not required for this position, they may help us understand your current proficiency level with certain technologies. Whether you possess certifications now or not, you may be required to obtain certain certifications as part of this position. Applicable certifications may include: Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE) Cisco Certified Network Associate VMWare (VCA or VCP) * Compensation* Compensation for this role will depend on current knowledge and experience. Initial salary will range from $75,000-$85,000 with the potential for growth. Along with your resume, please include a cover letter telling us a little about yourself and why you think you’d be an ideal candidate. We will be reviewing resumes as they come in and will be conducting interviews starting December 7th. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year Benefits: Flexible schedule Paid time off Schedule: Monday to Friday Experience: Network engineering: 3 years (Preferred) Work Location: Multiple locations This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is: People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture Company's website: www.AVAJEN.com Benefit Conditions: Only full-time employees eligible COVID-19 Precaution(s): Remote interview process

At AVAJEN our goal is to help people thrive, not just in the work environment but also your home life as well. By balancing onsite work with remote (work-from-home) workloads, we aim to promote a healthy work/life balance. We believe that people who are thriving in all aspects of life, will ultimately do their best work. Essentially, we want you to love your job and love working with our company!

This position is located in Denver, Colorado and requires candidates to live locally.

Job Description:

This position will cross over many skillsets and require knowledge in many facets of IT, including servers, networking, information security, cloud technologies, and End User Computing. Due to the nature of IT, the knowledge required in this position is expected to change frequently and we will all have to adapt to stay ahead of the industry. Below are some of the duties that will be required from this position:

  • Design creative IT solutions to meet the specific needs of our clients while following industry best practices and AVAJEN design standards. Solutions include:
  • Local server and cloud-based solutions for file sharing, email/faxing, user authentication, network and endpoint security, remote access, building management, data backup, End User Computing (EUC) such as VDI
  • EUC environments including full desktop/laptop and VDI/session-based
  • Work with clients onsite to build and manage IT systems and handle End User support requests. Direct interaction with clients means the candidate must have strong inter-personal skills and enjoy working with other people.
  • Work remotely within our ticketing system to resolve reported issues and track project progress.
  • When applicable, work with project managers to keep track of project milestones and timelines.
  • Stay informed with the AVAJEN monitoring system to ensure client network uptime and ultra-fast problem resolution.
  • Work with the AVAJEN IT Revolution team to evaluate the technologies in place as well as new technologies to continuously re-imagine and improve the way we provide IT services.
  • Track all working time in ticketing/billing system

Skills and Technologies

AVAJEN Systems Engineers need to have a very high aptitude for technology in general and a current working knowledge of a wide variety of existing network and IT system components and concepts.

This includes the following:

· Desktop and Server Operating Systems

o Windows 7 – 10

o Windows Server 2008 – 2019

o MacOS 10.13+

o Linux Variants including Red Hat, Ubuntu, etc.

· Server Technologies and Concepts

o Active Directory, Azure AD, and similar IDM solutions

o Role Based Access Control (RBAC)

o Exchange Server/Exchange Online (O365)

o File Sharing (SMB, DFS, NFS, etc.)

· Cloud Technologies

o SharePoint Online

o OneDrive

o Teams/Skype For Business

o Azure and AWS

o MDM and EMM platforms such as InTune and AirWatch

· Virtualization Technologies

o VMware

o Hyper-V

o Azure and AWS virtual machine infrastructure

· Storage Technologies

o iSCSI and Fiber Channel SANs

o Hyper-Converged Infrastructure

o Cloud Storage such as Azure Blob, etc.

· Networking Components and Technologies

o Firm understanding of the OSI model

o Routing and Switching concepts

§ TCP/IP, STP, NAT, Routing Protocols, VLANs, etc.

o Core Network Services

§ DNS, DHCP, NTP, etc.

o Firewall Concepts

§ Port forwarding (PAT), ACLs, IDP, DPI, etc.

o Wireless Network Technologies and concepts

§ 802.11n,ac,ax

§ WPA2/3

§ Site Survey and Access Point Placement Methodology

o Proxy and Reverse Proxy technologies

o Load Balancer technologies including DNS based GSLBs such as Traffic Manager

· Encryption Technologies for Data in Transit and Data at Rest

o VPN (IPSEC and SSL variants)

o HTTPS, SSL/TLS

o PKI

o BitLocker and PGP, Apple APFS with Filevault

o TPM 2.0 chips and T2 Chips and what they do

· Data Backup and Disaster Recovery Concepts and Strategies

o Local backup (Disk or Tape based)

o Cloud Backup

o Block level vs file level backup

o Site replication and failover technologies

· Remote Access Solutions

o VPN

o RDS/Citrix/Horizon

This may seem like a big list! The most important thing to us is that you have the aptitude to understand highly technical concepts and the willingness to learn what you don’t know. The vast number of technologies and systems that will come into play for this position will constantly evolve. If you are the right person for the job, this will seem like a fun task!

Education and Experience

Education specific to the skills required for this position are welcomed and encouraged. This includes college degrees and other forms of formal training in the skillsets listed above. It should be noted that direct experience with these technologies shall be the most important factor in selecting for this position. It is desired for this candidate to have at least 3-5 years of active experience working with the technologies and IT concepts listed above.

Certification

Industry certifications proving proficiency in any of the above technologies are welcomed and encouraged. Although certifications are not required for this position, they may help us understand your current proficiency level with certain technologies. Whether you possess certifications now or not, you may be required to obtain certain certifications as part of this position. Applicable certifications may include:

  • Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE)
  • Cisco Certified Network Associate
  • VMWare (VCA or VCP)

*

Compensation*

Compensation for this role will depend on current knowledge and experience. Initial salary will range from $75,000-$85,000 with the potential for growth.

Along with your resume, please include a cover letter telling us a little about yourself and why you think you’d be an ideal candidate. We will be reviewing resumes as they come in and will be conducting interviews starting December 7th.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Flexible schedule
  • Paid time off

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Experience:

  • Network engineering: 3 years (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • Multiple locations

This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:

  • People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects
  • Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction
  • Detail-oriented -- would rather focus on the details of work than the bigger picture

Company's website:

  • www.AVAJEN.com

Benefit Conditions:

  • Only full-time employees eligible

COVID-19 Precaution(s):

  • Remote interview process
